We hope you will come back and see us again soon.  If I can be of assistance in the future, please don't hesitate to contact me at 562-592-4770.  Thank you again for taking the time to complete the survey. We appreciate your loyalty to our brand.  Sincerely, Preston Front Desk Best Western Harbour Inn & Suites

Summary: Best Western come through again! Super close to the beach with a great view of the Harbor. More than enough options for the breakfast and extremely friendly staff! Definitely a good experience, and I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. Glad that you enjoyed your stay! Customer satisfaction is our top priority and we provide the best experience to our guests. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: First off let me say this hotel is in the perfect location. Very nice area. Wasn't afraid to leave my car overnight. Felt very safe. Has an elevator from the parking area into the main lobby. Lots of great restaurants and shops within walking distance. The hotel itself was beautifully decorated and extremely clean. We had a room with two balconies, one overlooked the harbor, the other overlooked PCH with an ocean view. Comfortable room...felt very big. Nice furniture. Everything you would expect from a nice hotel. The FULL breakfast was great and included freshly made waffles, eggs, potatoes, fruit, croissants and good coffee. The staff was exceptional !!! I WILL be going back again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for your kind review and recommendation.  We are delighted to note that you had a pleasant experience on that your stay with us; and appreciate your valuable feedback on our rooms and amenities as well as our services and food offerings.  Thank you once again for your review and for your patronage; and we are looking forward to welcoming you on your next stay with us.  with kindest regards,  The management team

Summary Heading: Hotel seems to be engaged in political activism
Summary: After checking in, when I first turned on the TV it was set to go to Fox News channel, as I don't like this channel I changed the settings to start from another channel. The problem is that on all 4 days that I stayed at this hotel when I returned at night the TV setting was again changed to start from Fox News. This was very annoying and obviously done on purpose as all TVs in the hotel (breakfast room, gym) were also on Fox News. So obviously the management of this hotel is engaged on political activism with this attitude. When I complained at the reception the explanation given was clearly false as they tried to blame the cable company. Very disappointing, not coming back.

Summary Heading: Great hotel close to the beach
Summary: Great hotel close to the beach, offered views of the harbor and beach.  Clean & neat, front desk staff were very pleasant.  The Sunset Beach / Huntington Beach area is far better than beaches and areas to the north.

Summary Heading: one of my best experiences with a hotel so far.
Summary: Excellent customer service and slept well the whole entire stay. The staff was so professional and very helpful. Will continue to recommend this particular location to all my friends and family. Keep up the great work!

We ended up here for a second stay for our annual girls trip. The first time we stayed here, it was absolutely amazing. The second time, although great for many reasons, fell short in experience from the year prior. The front desk management seemed less experienced and didn’t seem to understand or want to help when we told them that we had two separate reservations. Our water was shut off one day and we felt like we were always having to pick up our room since the cleaning service was so late in the day.  The breakfast was good and the location to the beach is perfect. This hotel does feel more like a small boutique hotel which we really like. Overall, we would probably stay here again.

Hotel was great, clean ,good service . My only complaint is eggs at breakfast are powdered and add a bit more breakfast items like bacon . Shower heads are high up and point directly at the back wall causing water on the floor ,otherwise everything else is good .

A completely no hassle stay.  I was here on business, spending a lot of time driving and just wanted simplicity, which I got.  Everything worked, parking was available.  I didn't get a chance to investigate restaurants but it looked like there were some decent ones in the neightborhood.

The is a prime location between the harbor and beach. Plenty of places to walk to for dinner. I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff were extremely kind and helpful. They were great with my kids too

My wife and I stayed two nights at this little hotel near Bolsa Chica State Beach. I was attending a conference in Huntington Beach, but we didn’t want to pay extra (especially for overnight valet parking) at the Hyatt Regency. My wife simply wanted to relax away from home, knit, read, and snooze.  This hotel was perfect for all that. We had a room on the north side of the third floor with a small balcony overlooking a quiet cove in Huntington Harbour. The hotel is on Pacific Coast Highway (State Highway 1), a busy thoroughfare during the afternoon hours, so our room picked up some of the noise. Consequently, I would not recommend having a room on the south side facing the highway. However, other than for the afternoon hours, PCH gets pretty quiet.  Our room was nicely

You can walk across the street to the beach. Plus, breakfast is delicious! The garage seemed safe, and they have elevators. There’s a snack,aching and a 7/11 across the street. The rooms have microwaves and refrigerators.

Very friendly staff, right across the street from the beach, quick and easy check in/out. Variety of breakfast foods that weren't the absolute best but still good. Parking lot is tight so be mindful of that. Rooms were average and felt congested but not an issue if all you need is a place to sleep. Clean and well kept but furniture is somewhat dated. Well satisfied with my stay and the price I paid for.

When we first arrived I wasn't sure what to expect. It looked small on outside, but there were always plenty of parking, beautiful room. Staff was so friendly and kind. They went above and beyond making our stay great. The manager waived the parking fee because I'm a best western member. The price was great for being so close to beach. Every morning I got to have chocolate chips pancakes, which made my day. They also had eggs and sausage. Our room even had a jetted tub.I slept great every night! I loved the decor above the bed.

We really liked the suite--decor was nice and we had two balconies. Bed was comfortable. Breakfast was decent. However, we encountered a major problem during our stay. The thermostat for the heat in the parlor didn't work. We reported it, but the repairman never showed up for work during our stay so we had no heat in that room. It got cold at night--especially the tile floor in the vanity area. One of the TV remotes didn't work and we reported that. Were given new batteries and that didn't work so the clerk said he would come and check it out but he didn't. The evening clerk finally did so we finally had 2 that worked. (The 2 TVs were different brands so needed different remotes.) We also had random water leaks--we think from the toilet in the bathroom--but we didn't report that.

Summary Heading: Our second stay was even more satisfying!
Summary: I love staying at the Best Western in Sunset Beach. We visited back in September for my boyfriend's birthday and we instantly knew we had to come back for mine in February. This time, we got what the staff called "the best room" and I couldn't agree more. We had everything we needed from a balcony with a view of the harbor to a very relaxing jetted tub, fridge and microwave and king-sized bed. Kayaking and incredibly tasty restaurants like Sunset Pizza and Pasta and Harry's Grill are within walking distance and add to the great experience of relaxing right across from beautiful Sunset Beach.

Summary Heading: Lovely place to spend some time
Summary: We chose this hotel as our place to crash the night before leaving on our Vow Renewal cruise. My husband is Diamond Elite at BW, so we were upgraded to a suite. Wish we'd arrived earlier in the day, as the suite was unbelievably nice! Great view of the harbor from the badroom balcony, great view of the street from the living room. Breakfast was hot and good. Parking could be tight if this hotel was booked, but we didn't have any problem finding a spot the night we arrived. Will definitely book this hotel the next time we're in the area!

The Best Western Harbour inn and Suites is located on the Pacific Coast Highway. It is a short walk to a long stretch of natural Beach on the Pacific Ocean. The Hotel has all the features needed  with comfortable bedrooms and a good breakfast provided.

Summary Heading: The perfect honeymoon and probably our best hotel stay!
Summary: We stayed in two other hotels on our way to California and on the way back home. There was no comparison to our Best Western Harbour Inn and Suites stay. You get what you pay for with these other motels/hotels running close to $100.00 a night without any amenities or ambiance. You pay a little more, but the difference is huge in the overall experience. The BW staff was extremely friendly and attentive. Not once did we enter the lobby without being greeted warmly or asked how our travels were for the day and if we enjoyed the specific activity we had done that day. They were genuinely interested and we had lengthy chats with all of the staff including housekeeping who were also so friendly and accommodating.  We stayed for three nights (adding the third night after canceling the

The garage entrance is inviting and parking no charge. The location and cost is spot on. Although the hotel is older, it is kept up well and very clean. I have stayed in a hotel down the street with ocean view and it was not nearly this nice nor was it clean.

Found the hotel room clean and cozy. Breakfast wasn't as good as we have had at other hotels. All and all worth the amount charged. Would consider staying again if we were to stay in that area again. We had to drive to long beach to find restaurants that were nicer

Summary Heading: A Place to Relax and Explore!
Summary: Closely nestled near the beach in walking distance of a variety of restaurants and shops we had a lovely stay here. Our experience certainly gave us a family feel, like a home away from home.  We appreciate the idea of no pets reflecting the freshness and cleanliness when you walk in. The tropical decor sets an exotic vacation feeling. Having a view from the balcony, a comfortable bed gave us a restful night and the convenience of a microwave and fridge in the room made our stay  memorable. The staff was pleasant willing to assist when we needed. Don't wait too late to partake in the exceptional and flavorful complimentary breakfast serving everything from waffles,fluffy scrambled eggs, tasty peppered potatoes, juicy sausage, fruit, yogurt, cereal, and a variety of coffee which

This property was fine for a trip to Orange County. The room was comfortable and the location is close to many beaches. There is no pool or hot tub or any outside seating area. I have stayed at other properties near the beach that had beach chairs and toys you could use and this one only had towels, which is a shame because it has a good location walking distance to the beach. Also this is not a touristy part of town so there aren't a lot of restaurants and shops to walk to.The employees are very nice and do make you feel welcome. For the right price I would say go ahead and stay here. Don't expect a resort experience but it makes a nice home base for a trip where you drive out every day.
Manager Response: Hello Traveler,  Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback on how you felt about your experience at our hotel. We appreciate your honesty and hope we can utilize your feedback for future changes to the hotel in order to provide a better experience for the customer. Thank you and we hope to see you again!  Guest Service Coordinator Andrew

Summary: A friend and I stayed at this Best Western for three nights.  Rooms were clean and well equipped.  Towels were clean and fluffy.  The bed was comfortable but more firm than I usually find in most hotels. We missed the continental breakfast by about 30 mins one morning, but one of the staff members grabbed some bowls for us so we could at least have some cereal and grab a coffee - great service!  If you’re going to the beach, they have beach towels - just ask!!!  Overall, the staff were friendly and accommodating.    The location of this hotel is great for a relaxed beach visit, with some great restaurants close by.  I’d stay here again.

Anita on Reception was fantastic, nothing is too much trouble and she is always cheerful and is a real credit to the company.  The room was lovely, clean, tidy and extremely comfortable.  The hotel is just across from the beach and is situated on a lovely harbour.  The breakfast in the morning is very nice with a wide selection of choice.  Lovely hotel and well worth a visit.

The staff was amazing and went above and beyond to take care of us. Anita, especially, stood out because of her hospitality, kind attitude and willingness to help. I'm still new to the process of checking into hotels and forgot to notify my bank I was traveling. Instead of turning us away and leaving us embarrassed, she made sure I knew all the right numbers to call to get everything handled so we could still enjoy our two-night stay. She even stayed after clocking out just to make sure we were good before she left. She was such a sweet woman! The king suite was very comfortable and there was plenty to do with restaurants, bars and the beach just steps away. The bed felt like a cloud and the balcony had a great view of both the harbor and PCH. Sam also made checking out easy and

We was there for three nights.  Bad things: The Hotel is not realy new. In the first room we get, the tv was not working and the Laguage service was broken. Then we get an other room and there was the Tablelight not working. But it dosen‘t matter for us. The Parkingspace is limited and a little tiny. God Things:  The room is silent. No noise from the highway.  Very friendly staff. The free wifi is fast.  Big, clean rooms.  Breakfast was good.  Near to the beach. I recommend it and come again.

From the Staff to the Beautiful Clean Room our stay was exceptional.  The View from our room was Awesome.  The Room was very clean.  The staff were all so very nice. Our bed was very comfortable.  Breakfast was very good.  One of the cleanest hotels I have stayed in. This is our second time staying here and we will be back again next year!

We really enjoyed our stay at BW Western Harbour! Came to see our kids who live right down the street! Staff was great! Short walk to the beach. Having a local transit bus stop nearby saved us a bunch on local site seeing! Example... a ride to Huntington Beach Pier $ 20.00 one way with Uber...    $ 1.50 on the bus and that's round trip! We will definitely return again!

Hotel staff was friendly and very accommodating.  I arrived at 11:30am, by 12pm they had a room cleaned for me.  I would and will stay at this hotel again. Great location - right across the street from the beach!

very nice clean hotel. 7/11 and liquor store right across the street (if you need things). breakfast was a nice spread. room very clean and spacious. close to the beach. I would definitely stay here again if in the area.

Pros: clean room, friendly staff (when I got her attention from looking out the window while we stood there for 20 seconds). Typical free breakfast. Short 2 blocks to the beach.  Cons: Parking for a few small vehicles on ground floor. Not much around for food.  Appear to be in the low income end of town. Noisy street out front (Hwy 101)

Summary Heading: Great location, super friendly helpful staff, big comfortable room for a one week stay !
Summary: Harbour Inn was a one week staying in the middle of a 21 day Coast to Coast bucket /birthday trip. We chose it for location to friends in Belmont Shore and Huntington Beach,and a chance to relax during a hectic travel schedule. Staff were friendly professional and very helpful, the room we chose was a balcony street view, not noisy, big comfy bed, few steps to the lobby with endless coffee and adequate free breakfast. Free secure parking was a bonus, Sunset Beach literally across the road, great local bar Brix, great food craft beer and good live bands. Laundry service across the street was a bonus as we had been travelling for 12 days. Loved the Hotel highly recommend.

Summary Heading: great locaion, andrew and carmita were great!
Summary: Andrew was awesome! he was very sweet, I was pestering him for about two days prior to check in and he was always more than happy to help. Carmita was also amazing, she went out of her way to help me. The front desk clerk anita was horrible. She was very unprofessional and rude. I had an issue with the room, instead of apologizing she just talked over me.. I asked for a late check out, I thought she would be more understanding considering the situation I had with the room, she only gave me 30 extra minutes and then proceeded to tell me that housekeepers were going to come up to my room either way, it was extremely unprofessional. Thankfully carmita seen that I was struggling with my luggage, she even brought me a luggage cart and just left it by the door so I could load
Manager Response: Dear Dilcia,  We are sorry you had a bad check-out experience. Carmina needed to clean the room as it was one of our busiest holidays so yes, she was certainly trying to help you along as she is housekeeping and under pressure to get the rooms clean. You had mentioned you worked at another Best Western. Being a fellow hotel employee, you would know July 4th is a very busy day trying to accommodate late check-outs as well as guests trying to check in as early as 8:40 am when check-in time is 3 pm. There were no late check-outs on July 4th for you or any guests. We TRY to accommodate late check-outs but they certainly are not guaranteed, especially on a holiday in a boutique hotel.  We gave you a 11:30 check-out time but still were unable enter the room until 12 pm due to you still being in the room.   As far as the problem with your room, Anita reported the problem right away. It was the manager on sight calling your room the second time. The manager waited at the front desk to assist you as most guests with such a problem always address the front desk to try and resolve the issue. With such an issue, we were slightly confused why you would want to stay LONGER in a room that you were uneasy in.   We are glad to hear how awesome you think Andrew and Carmina are and how the cleaning staff delivered on your expectations for fast and consistent service. We hope to see you again in the future. Please call the hotel directly for late check-out information.  Sincerely, Anne Goddard Front Desk Manager

Summary: great location. walking distance to everything...restaurants, beaches, kayaking. good rates and friendly staff. quiet and clean rooms. free breakfast! free parking! very nice stay for a relaxing beach visit
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review, the staff and I appreciate the time you took to express your view on the hotel. It was a privilege being your host, and we hope to be your host on another visit to the charming Sunset Beach! Thank you again.  Best Regards,  Andrew BW Harbour Inn & Suites

Summary: We really enjoyed the Best Western Harbor Inn at Sunset Beach, Ca. The location was great! Just a short walk to Sunset beach. Andrew was wonderful at giving us suggestions for places to eat. We enjoyed chatting with him. I would definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: Hello Christine, Thank you so much for staying with us and your review, we enjoyed having you here at our hotel and glad you had a good time. We all look forward to your next stay!  Sincerely,      Andrew

Summary Heading: Stayed here two nights for a graduation at Long Beach State.
Summary: I would give it a 3 + if possible.   It is an older hotel which has been updated.  The rooms were clean and comfortable with all the necessary amenities. However, we could not open our balcony slider as it is on a very busy street, hence lots of auto noise.  It was fine with the door closed though.  The continental breakfast was very nice with several choices of food and drink.  The staff was very pleasant.   Parking is under the hotel, but not a lot of spaces so some street parking was necessary
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for sharing your review of our property, we are glad you enjoyed your stay for the most part. I apologize as with having a central location can have some rooms facing outward to the street. We acknowledge this and try our best to reduce this with double pane glass; otherwise, we hope to see you again soon, and thank you for your time!  Andrew

Summary: I stayed in this hotel for a family reunion in Huntington Beach. The location was convenient to my brother's home, where most family stayed, to the beach, and to a craft fair that happened that weekend. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable. I would recommend this Best Western.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel, we are a boutique hotel so every guest counts and we try to make each and every person happy with their stay. Hopefully we will see you on your next reunion or venture to the beach!

Summary: My friend and I stayed at the Best Western Harbour Inn in Huntington Beach May 14-16th, 2018.  Anita was working the front desk and was the only one we came in contact with coming and going.  She was incredibly kind, friendly, professional, personable, and upbeat.  We asked for recommendations for places to eat.  She recommended Pelican Isle and Harbor House Café.  She was spot on!!  We liked the Pelican Isle so much we had lunch there both days.  The Harbor House Café was also an excellent choice as the breakfast was great with large portions.  Anita had the best customer service of any hotel staff that I've come in contact with.  The beds were also very comfortable as we overslept on check out day!

Fun hotel at the beach. Very clean and well decorated. Excellent value.  Nicely decorated and clean. One-night stay was too short. Free parking, strong connectivity and great breakfast service. Large room was very pleasant.

Stayed here for a family event and the stay was outstanding. The hotel itself, the service is all ex-par. Definitely will come back here again. Recommend that you stay here for an excellent experience.

We chose this Best Western because of its combination of price and nearness to the beach.  We were not disappointed.  Renting a room on the backside of the hotel facing the lagoon, we found it to be clean, comfortable, and mostly quiet.  Some of what we liked most, though, was being able to walk to the beach.  That was a major plus.  Our only complaint (and it's minor) is that we weren't too thrilled with the water pressure or even the physical dimensions of the shower.  Otherwise, five stars.

Summary Heading: Hold the presses!  Did we just get a bad room?
Summary: Wow, I cannot believe the good reviews!  The only reason this place even gets 2 stars is because the front desk gal tried to be helpful. The underground parking is tight but if you're careful, doable, and its free, always a plus. The hotel is not a block and a half from the beach. No, its not. To access the beach, you must walk a couple blocks, cross a very busy highway (fortunately, there's a light!) and then walk a few more blocks. Certainly not a quick easy jaunt with toddlers or young children, strollers, etc. We were surprised at our room. Large and ok but the bathroom...I've enclosed a few photos.We were, well, surprised. It was a handicap accessible geriatric bathroom which we didn't need and I sure don't remember requesting! As you can see, there was an ugly stained
Manager Response: Dear Mrs. Lamosse,      We are very sorry you were so unhappy with your room. We do try to solve any problems with reservations and room mishaps. I see that you booked through a third party which sometimes causes problems with rooms and communications. Although you did not need the accessible room, I show that is the room you reserved through Agoda. My best suggestion while booking through a third party is to call the hotel directly so they can accommodate your needs, as we would have done as well.      I thought while trying to help resolve the problems you were facing, we had a good re pore but I am sorry you felt like we intruded on your personal space. The previous guest in that room had called us to report the smoke detector going off as he had forgot to tell us at check out so, again, we just didn't want you to be uncomfortable. Again, we are very sorry for your poor experience with us.

Summary: For a good, no frills hotel a block from the beach, you can't beat this.  Nice and clean, no bugs or mildew or weird smells.  I was worried that parking might be an issue, but there is a lot on the ground floor that isn't too difficult to maneuver, even with an SUV.  Desk staff was friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Just right for our Honeymoon weekend.
Summary: Super customer service, good location, harbor view rooms with jacuzzi suite was just the right  honeymoon weekend. We loved how close it was to the beach. We loved our room with the harbor view.  Thank you to all the staff, we will return to this little boutique hotel.

We spent 2 nights here, wished it could've been longer! 2 fantastic clerks, Annie and Anita..our room was spacious and very clean. We loved our balcony, breakfast was great! Already made reserv for AUG.
Manager Response: Dear Carol, It was so nice to meet you!  We look forward to your return in August!  We appreciate your kind words and thoughtful review.  Sincere Wishes, Annie Goddard. Front Desk Manager

Summary: We had the great stay at the best western harbor inn & suites.  Great location, right on PCH. 5 miles to Huntington pier. Extra large room, comfortable king bed and very quiet. The bathroom design is practical and convenient with large jet tub. The front desk ladies are very warm, friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was very good too. Superb value!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great review! We appreciate your feedback and kind words.  We have a wonderful and truly dedicated team of staff members. Please do come again and stay with us, Safe Travels, Annie Goddard, Front Desk Manager Best Western Harbour Inn & Suites-Sunset Beach, CA

Summary: Enjoyed our stay here for 2 nights close to Huntington beach and away from busy downtown LA. Not much to look at from outside but inside was very clean, spacious rooms with very friendly front desk staff and breakfast lady. The rooms were spotlessly clean and comfy beds, clean sheets, towels and bathroom well kept. Carpet was fine despite showing signs of wear. Overall would return here if in the vicinity and will recommend as a good value location near the beaches. Thanks.

Summary Heading: Affordable and nice hotel in a convenient location.
Summary: i booked this hotel for a stay from 2/19 - 2/23/2018. I had never been to the Sunset Beach area and so many hotels has such horrible reviews that I was worried I'd never find one on the budget provided by my company. The reviews for this hotel are spot on, the desk clerks are very courteous and helpful, maintenance is great and housekeeping is spectacular. I stayed in room 321 and had a problem with some kind of backup in the sink during my stay and alerted the front desk staff who immediately contacted maintenance to have it looked at, but in the mean time had the swiftly cleaned by housekeeping. I would definitely not hesitate to stay at this hotel again and am so glad I listened to the other reviews!!   Pros: Location is convenient to Huntington Beach and only a block from

We stayed here for a few nights over a cold weekend in February. Annie at the front desk was super friendly, helped us check-in and get settled, and gave great restaurant recommendations nearby. We felt very comfortable here, and would recommend Best Western Harbour Inn & Suites to anyone looking to stay in the area. Loved that you could cross the street and access Sunset beach! Fantastic value for families!

Annie and company were amazingly helpful, from info on nearby restaurants, shopping, BARS and water taxi schedules to tipsy late night arrivals. All did their utmost to make sure we had an extraordinary experience.  We already have our reservations for next year.
Manager Response: Dear Richard - Thank you for your kind words.  We love our roles here and love the guests even more!  Thank you for being our Guest and we sincerely look forward to your next visit. Until then, Safe Travels!  Warmly, Annie Goddard, Front Desk Manager

Summary: Wow!!! This hotel and staff are amazing. Every staff member was polite and outgoing. Annie was phenomenal and made this stay the best yet. The hotel was great location, price point was spot on, free parking, breakfast, and WiFi. Will stay again. If you are looking to book just go ahead and do so. You will not regret it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words and positive review Jeffery!  All of the team members here take great pride in our roles and sincerely enjoy greeting and helping the guests as much as we can!  Thank you so much! Safe Travels!

Summary: Very friendly staff, who made our stay great.  Breakfast was continental, but waffles were good.  Small hotel, close to the beach makes this location ideal for beach adventures.  Annie was so nice and friendly at arrival, our trip was bound to be great.  Thanks Annie for recommending Crystal Cove, we had such a relaxing time enjoying the beach and nature.  Great day and stay, will definitely return.

Clean room, daily service and versatile breakfast buffet with "make your own waffles" menu + friendly, responsive & competent staff at your service.  Close to many and a variety of beach restaurants. Parking somewhat limited in 1st floor garage.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your nice review and thank you for visiting Sunset Beach and the Best Western Harbour Inn & Suites!  We appreciated your helpful and positive feedback. Please come visit us again, Annie Goddard, Front Desk Manager

Summary: After long international flight it was great to relax here for a few days while we recovered from jet lag, and spend time with friends. Very comfortable room with Harbour views, clean and tidy and a good breakfast. Pleasant and helpful staff.

The hotel is very clean, friendly/helpful staff, good breakfast, free wifi plus the beach is right across the street. Cute and not too busy part of Los Angeles which normally isn't easy to find. This is a great hotel and I will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Best hotel experience, clean, comfortable and great location
Summary: This little hotel was great. Very clean and staff was excellent. Ann at the front desk is the best. The hotel is one block from Sunset Beach. I will definitely stay here again if I ever get back California. I highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Laura, It was such a pleasure to meet you and thank you for staying at our hotel!  We all take pride in our roles and are very happy you enjoyed your stay.  Please do come again and safe travels and Happy Holidays!  Annie Godard

Summary: Location Perfect! Walk across the street to the Beach. Rooms Nice & Large. Bed & Pillows very comfortable. Breakfast that comes with the room rate, very Enjoyable! Pleasant Staff! Plenty of good restaurants near by

Summary Heading: best hotel in Huntington Beach area
Summary: we just love this place. Its very well kept and very nice rooms. hotel stuff is the nicest , we have ever met and they told us everything where to go. Restaurants and grocery in walking distance. Minutes away from the ocean

Picked this hotel because of proximity to beach. Great location. Staff was helpful. Free parking. Overall a great value. Will stay here again. Plenty  of food and beach activities nearby. Best value was because of off-season.

The location is convenient and easy to find. The parking lot is the 1st level with the rest of the hotel on top of it, so it's very compact and fits a lot into the space it has. The rooms are comfortable and clean. I'd go out of my way to stay here again.

Booked our stay at the Best Western Sunset beach because of the location which was on the Harbour, however the beach was also convientlly located across the street. My friends had planned a Duffy boat ride through the Harbour with dancing and drinks. The entire weekend was a huge success.

I travel frequently to this area and this is the hotel I stay at. Every single staff member treats you like you are their only guest. They  are very welcoming, they make sure you have what you need and that you will enjoy your stay with them. Rooms are very clean and roomy. Everything is easily accessible.

Summary Heading: Close to beach and fun restaraunts
Summary: This hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the beach, just be careful crossing the street.  Close to some fun local restaurants. I tried out King Neptunes and Turcs and enjoyed the atmosphere at both of them.  Located on the Pacific Coast Highway, you have easy access to many places.
Manager Response: Dear Dawn, Thank you for your nice reviews and I am glad you enjoyed Turcs and King Neptune's!  They both get good reviews!  Please come back and visit us, until then, Safe Travels.  Annie Goddard, Front Desk Manager

Summary: Excellent staff.  Great Location.  Room was well appointed.  Breakfast options were limited for gluten-intolerant person.  I opted for boiled egg and piece of fruit.  Read the yogurt package and it was suspect.  Vending machines were all out of order, so I had to bring bottled water in.  Couldn't beat the location with private parking.
Manager Response: Thank you for you review.  We are working hard to improve and add more options to our gluten free selection.  We appreciate your input and hope to see you again!  Safe Travels. Annie Goddard-Front Desk Manager-Best Western Harbour Inn & Suites, Sunset Beach, CA

Summary: Great location! The beach right across the street was wonderful!  Rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good, not a huge variety, but my family was happy with it. We plan on staying here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review and we appreciate your helpful suggestions.  We are always looking for ways to improve our breakfasts and it can be difficult as we have a very limited kitchen area. I have already been in touch with our General Manager regrading more gluten free choices for breakfast!  Please come again and safe travels! Annie Goddard, Front Desk Manager

Summary: The hotel rooms were well decorated but had problems. The toilet would not flush. It took 2-3 flushes. The rooms on the road side were noisy. Parking was difficult and you needed to make 3 and 4 point turns to get out.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review - in the future, please always let the front desk personnel know of any room issues we are well trained and can take care of them or have other staff who can be called upon.  We do have rooms overlooking PCH, which most guests really enjoy and we are located in a quaint, rustic beach town and we are on the corner of Park and PCH/the famous Highway 1 --- in the future please call the hotel to double check and one may always look on "google maps".  Please call me directly should you have any more concerns.  I am very sorry we did not meet your expectations - Annie Goddard, Front Desk Manager.

Summary: Easy to find, building very clean, wonderful check-in, very helpful. Room was very big and very comfortable and clean.  I highly recommend this property.  Easy parking and excellent location to fun things to do in Huntington Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you ever so much for your wonderful review!  We love working here and serving our guests, Please do come back and stay with us again!  Safe Travels!  Annie Goddard

Summary: My wife and I were in So Cal to visit a sick relative and decided to stay at the Harbour Inn & Suites.  Excellent service, the room as very clean and well maintained. We definitely plan to stay there again soon.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review.   We take great pride in our hotel and the staff sincerely enjoy their roles! Please do come back and stay with us again!  Annie Goddard - Front Desk

Summary: My first trip to Southern California for a wedding in Long Beach. We chose this place because it had a water view, was within budget, and balconies.   Pros:   - very comfy bedding/beds. Not too firm and not too soft. I forgot to ask what kind of mattresses they were using.   - free parking under the hotel, very cool!  - it's a small hotel, so not too far to walk from the elevator while lugging bags AND they have luggage carts as well, so that's awesome.  - rooms had refrigerators and microwaves!   - rooms had not only a bible, but the teachings of Buddha (thought that was kind of fun and interesting  - all of the staff were ridiculously friendly and helpful. For real! It was like being in an alternate universe of friendliness.  Cons:  - breakfast is a bit lacking. It's standard
Manager Response: Dear Alicia,  Thank you for being our guest!  And Thank You for your kind and very helpful reviews.  We are happy you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again!  I am very sorry our breakfast did not meet all of your expectations.  We usually do have peanut butter and we have them in the little "Jif" packs.  We have "Soy"Milk and we keep it in the bottom shelf of the clear door refrigerator that is kept in the dinning room with all of our other Breakfast Items. I am very sorry you missed those food items or perhaps we were temporarily out (?).   Most Best Western's hire 1 to 2 Breakfast Host's who help the guests find the food, provide gluten free options, refill  the food, etc.  We have one host as well, although she is off 2 days a week, which our front desk personnel can usually handle the breakfast room.  Next time, please ask and we will do our best to provide for you.  We value our guests very much and many come back year after year, season after season!  We look forward to seeing you back here, with us, at Sunset Beach!  Warmly, Annie Goddard-Front Desk Manager

Summary: Lovely hotel with very friendly staff. Annie at the front desk made us feel very welcome and gave us many recommendations for our trip. We would like to thank her for making our stay better that it ever could have been!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for you nice review and kind words...we all enjoy helping our guests have the best experience ever!  Please come back and visit us again!  Safe Travels!  Annie

Summary: Great location and room.  Annie made us feel very welcome and made our stay really enjoyable. Huntington beach is less than a 10 minute drive and Sunset beach is just across the road. Sunset beach lives up to its namesake, having really picturesque sunsets, which was at around 7pm in August.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful comments...Brilliant Hotels have Brilliant Guests, please come back and visit us anytime!  We love helping people have a nice vacation. Annie

Summary Heading: Good Value. Housekeeping was great. Front desk staff was very nice. Close to good, reasonable restaurants.
Summary: This hotel is a good value! The room was wonderful; clean, spacious and well appointed. It had a microwave and good sized fridge and coffee pot and hair dryer.  The bed was comfortable.  We both have bad backs and we didn't have a problem. The housekeeping staff did a great job.  Everyone at the front desk was very helpful and very nice!  Try it, you'll like it!
Manager Response: Dear Valued  Guest - Thank you for your kind words and we are so happy you had a wonderful stay! We all take great pride in this hotel and value your comments very much!  Please come back and visit us here in Sunset Beach at the Best Western Harbor Inn & Suites. Annie Goddard - Front Desk

Summary Heading: A quaint hotel that met all of our travel needs
Summary: We booked for one night and when we arrived we booked for a second night and wished we could have stayed a week!  Located about a block from the beach, and right next to the marina, location was excellent!  Front Desk staff were amazing with their willingness to assist with answering questions about where to go in the community or to find a good place for dinner.   The hotel is very small with 27 rooms.  However don't let small deceive you with meeting your hotel needs.  Parking is below the hotel on the first floor.  An elevator or staircase is available to get to the second floor registration desk.  Breakfast is served in the room next to the registration area.  Rooms are a nice size with a good sitting area on the attached balcony.  Location is excellent in relation to
Manager Response: Thank you so much Dean for your kind and thoughtful review.  We are excited about our community here and the hotel!  We really enjoy our guests who come and stay.  Please do come back and stay with us again - Safe Travels!  Annie

Summary: My friends and I were traveling up the coast hitting different cities and we stayed here overnight. Doesn't look like much from the street, but we were pleasantly surprised by the rooms. The lady at the front desk was really nice and helpful!! It is just a short drive to the beach. I would recommend anyone in the area stay here.
Manager Response: Hello, I am the lady at the front desk and my names is Annie - Thank you so much for your wonderful review, we appreciate your kind words.  Please come back and visit us again, in the meantime, Safe Travels!  Annie

Summary: We came to Huntington for a concert. I requested an early check-in, which the Best Western tried to accommodate. I requested the early check-in just hours before we arrived and they were still able to check us in an hour early. The rooms were clean, the beds were relatively comfortable, and the staff was helpful. The only we had was with the breakfast that was provided. My friends and I all have special dietary needs and we were unable to eat most of the foods provided.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words in your review.  We sincerely appreciate your review and your feedback.  We are sorry the breakfast at the hotel did not meet your needs:  We offer hard boiled eggs, yogurts, 6 kinds of cereal-2 which are gluten free, 5 pastries-2 which are gluten free, 3 fresh fruits, 4 types of fruit juice, fresh home-made waffles, assorted teas and coffee's.  Please in the future, try and call ahead and we will do our best to meet any special diet needs.  Thank you again for your review and safe travels!  Annie

Summary: Second time staying at this hotel. Both times stayed to attend family weddings. It was a good value for what we paid. Especially since the world surf championship was in town. Other hotels raised their rates. Very close walk to the beach. Restaurants, 7/11 and liquor store are across the street. Kayaking/paddle board rental right next door. Ask for the quiet side when you make your reservation. We had a view of the marina our first stay. This time they didn't have rooms with a view available, but we got one on the quiet side and it was quite large. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The room decor/furniture could use a bit of a refresh, but it was very clean. Overall I would recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review.  We sincerely appreciate it when guests take the time to complete a review.  We are very happy you had a good time and hope to see you back again soon!  Check-out our lower rates for the Fall and Winter Seasons.  Annie-Front Desk

Summary: This is a very nice hotel.  The room was big.  There were many amenities:  Coffeemaker, iron and board, big screen TV, good free wifi.   We had a balcony, but it was overlooking busy Pacific Coast Hwy.  It was noisy.  There was a wall air-conditioner that shut off during the night.  Leaving the sliding door open was not an option due to the noise.  Big bathroom.  Two queen beds. Pleasant breakfast room with the usual continental breakfast fare plus hard-boiled eggs.  Free Parking is under the structure.  I never had a problem finding a space even though the area was small. Walk across the street to the beach.  Staff was very nice. Slightly over-priced.

We come here every year for our annual high school get together.  This hotel is by far the best!  We will stay here from now on because of its staff, its location, and for the comfort and cleanliness of the room.

Older hotel, but everything was clean, beds and sheets and pillows were nice.  Towels were worn and some even had holes in them. My towels at home are way better. That would be my only real complaint.  The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  They made me feel right at home. I loved being able to sit out on the balcony of my room and enjoy the breeze coming off of the ocean.

Our family had three rooms for a family get-together. The hotel was perfect and the staff was extremely accommodating. I've stayed in five star hotels in my many travels, but the warm feeling of this one far surpasses others. It was a wonderful experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for you kind review!  We were happy you had a wonderful family get together! We are always happy to hear that we met your expectations.  We all love our roles here and very dedicated to the hotel.  Please come back and stay with us again! Annie Goddard - Front Desk Manager

Summary: Awesome!!!!!!!! Easy, comfortable and fun. Low key and quiet rooms. Convenience for beaches & restaurants, very nice. Very friendly staff and the area around the Best Western was great. The local beaches in the area are great, but Sunset beach was the best to go and visit and just relax. When you are done just walk across the street and you can relax until it is time for more fun. I will be back as soon as I can.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful and kind reviews!  From the Housekeeping staff, to the owners and all of the front desk team we are happy you enjoyed your stay with us!  Please do come back and see us again...We will be here...waiting!  Annie Goddard, Front Desk Manager

Summary: Room wasnt clean, ceiling stained with Wine or mold. Told staff, they did not clean it. Couldnt move us to another room. Sofa bed not conducive for sleeping. Extremely unconfortable. Wont go there again.

We booked a harbor view & was not disappointed.  The staff was very friendly & helpful.  The breakfast was adequate for a continental breakfast.  The room was spotless & the bed was comfortable.  The parking was typical of a beach town.  Tried to use the snack vending machine, but wouldn't accept $ or credit card.  Beach was across the street so we could walk there.  Yes, we would stay there again.

The location of this hotel is great! It's right off of PCH and close to all of the small towns along the coast. That is about all I would recommend for this hotel. The beds are planks and the bathrooms are from 1985. Large rooms with outdated everything except the TV. There are about 10 parking spots in a super cramped "lot" for the entire hotel. Since you're already spending so much, I would spend a little more to upgrade to a better hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, We are sorry we did not meet your expectations.  We actually have excellent beds, a great Continental breakfast with a wide variety of items, our bathrooms are all modern and were all re-done just a few years ago.  The parking is "cramped", but this is due to the fact land is very limited in Southern California and especially Sunset Beach.  Our rates are very reasonable.  You could spend a little more, but in reality it will be $200.00 to $300.00 more per night for the Hyatt, etc in Huntington Beach or even the Pacific Inn.  Again, we are sorry not to have met your expectations.  Annie

Summary Heading: Misrepresentation this isn't Huntington Beach 6/7 miles out
Summary: The wife and I are huge Best western fans , and on this trip to USA we actually stayed in 11  nights out of a 32 day tour , however whereas this small hotel is OK ! And the staff are great as they always are at best Western , we were very very disappointed that we were so far away from Huntington Beach ( especially as Best western do have hotels in the town which are quite rightly called Huntington Beach ) it was a drive every day on what can only be discribed a s avert very fast dangerous road to pull out on , why they don't call it Seaside Near Huntington Beach , so we it is highlighted as being away from the town , I don't know  We were very disappointed as this was our last stop on a 6000 mile tour around 5 states , and just wanted to leave the car in the hotel car park and
Manager Response: Dear Guest, We are sorry we did not meet your expectations.  In the future please give your hotel a call and research your locations on google maps.  We are 5 miles from downtown Huntington Beach, we are actually part of Huntington Beach, located in a small community referred to as "SUNSET BEACH", we are very popular with many travelers from around the world as well as locals.  Many of our guests have been coming for years.  We have several excellent restaurants within a short walk, a few dress shops, an antique nautical shop, a flower and garden shop and a few art studios, a candy shop and even a surf shop!  But yes, most of the shopping is located in the more commercial communities of Huntington Beach, Seal Beach and Long Beach.  Please give us a try again, Safe Travels, Annie

Summary Heading: Location was not what I expected
Summary: The room was clean and the whirlpool bath amazing.  Breakfast was not brilliant and if you expect to be anywhere near Huntington Beach you will be disappointed.  However, it was cheaper than being at Huntington, we just didn't realise it was quite so far away (6 miles).

It is the BEST for you money... Staff excellent, CLEAN, TIKI BEACH... LOVE IT.. We will be going back... Maybe for a weekend or MAYBE for our all Class Reunion held in September in Huntington Beach!! Can't wait to stay there again 😜

Summary Heading: Very enjoyable stay at the Best Western Harbour Inn, Sunset Beach
Summary: I always look forward to staying at this hotel when I am in the area.  Awesome location and very helpful, friendly staff make it so easy to enjoy all the amenities the area offers.  Close proximity to beach walks, stand up paddling and wonderful restaurants for dining just seems to create a wonderful experience in Sunset Beach.

After horrid experience down the road, Gary the night guy was soooo nice and helpful.  It was great to have some compassion that late!  The room was very clean, he brought us more towels right away! parking was ok, Balcony was lovely, the beds were really good, its a bit far to walk to other things but it was good and the owners the next morning at breakfast were so sweet!

Summary Heading: Typical BW styled room w great staff
Summary: We stayed with our toddler in a king room. The window was headed to the back and so It was very quiet and recommend if you have a light sleep.  Because there is a private property in the back of the BW the room was pretty dark und you are just watching the facade of this next property.   The room was clean and had a fridge, a microwave and a coffee machine. The king bed was a bit hard but we like it this way.  The shower is a bit outdated but it was acceptable. The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast from 06.30 to 09.30. They don't have a kitchen and so they can't serve scrambled eggs or bacon. But they have a good choice of cereal, bakery, waffles, coffee, tee and several juices.  The "breakfast lady" was wonderful and caring.   The spacious parking lot is first floor so the

Staff was very welcoming and helpful. They gave us the suite even though we paid for the 2 queens room because it was available. It had a view on the harbor and a in-room jacuzzi... apart from that the furniture in the room was a little old, but clean and in good shape.

This hotel is perfect for a budget hotel in Huntington Beach. You get what you pay for?! Staff were friendly & helpful.....It was basic, but clean & included breakfast albeit a small selection. It is approx 2 miles from Huntington Beach & easy to get to - We visited Hollywood/LA also whilst staying here which was an easy commute. Would definitely use again if we returned.

Summary Heading: A place to lay your head down
Summary: This was the absolute best deal I could find in Huntington/Newport in July. This was just a quick stop, not really vacation. It was a regular Best Western. It was clean, easy to access, and close to the beach. Staff was very very friendly!  If I was trying to go on a vacation, go to the beach and so on, I would not stay here. It was good for a one night stay just driving through but thats it.

The harbor was a scum filled pond with beached boats and trash. The view was hideous. The décor was dated and the colors were dark and various shades of rust and yellow; not a beach motif  at all. The pillows were lumpy and the area seemed a little run down. A fair price for that room in my opinion would have been about 69 -70 dollars per night. Breakfast buffet did not look appealing and I chose to eat out.
Manager Response: We are sorry we did not meet your expectations and we are a bit confused as we are actually wondering if you have mistaken our hotel for another?  The Harbor at low tide is not filled with trash or scum, it is referred to as "algae" and it is needed for food for the fish and other animals.  The boats are not "beached" some boat owners prefer to keep their smaller boats pulled up on the sand.  The decor is a beach, pacific theme and is usually very popular with our Guests.  The Sunset Beach community is not run down...it is very beachy and has a low beach vibe feeling.  I am sorry you felt your pillow was "lumpy", in the future, please contact the front desk and we can have it replaced immediately!  The Continental Breakfast we provide has 6 varieties of cereal, 3 kinds of milk, 4 juices, 4 coffee's, a variety of teas, 5 kinds of pastries and jellies, hard boiled eggs and homemade fresh waffles, plus 3 fresh fruits....we are very sorry this was not enough for you.  Annie

Summary: We chose this hotel due to the location of the hotel , the size and the reviews. We were not disappointed at all . We were allowed early check in , recommendations for places to visit , compliments on our family and overall excellent customer service.  The room size was long and spacious . The balcony was a nice touch just wish the view was better then a green marsh , I believe it was low tide In the harbor.  The private beach within walking distance was great . The rooms were clean and modern .  Comfy beds, soft towels. The breakfast was nothing special, basic rolls, muffins,no hot foods but great coffeee.

Picked this hotel because it is centrally located to the beach and another attraction.  The room was beautiful.  The beds were comfortable.  We had a cute little balcony overlooking  PCH.  The front desk clerk was very helpful and pleasant.  She told us of the amenities and breakfast from 6-9:30.  The breakfast was wonderful with a big array of choices.  The dining area was very clean.  I will definitely come here again

Staff is excellent, rooms are nice and big. Very close to the beach. If you liked to be more secluded from the mainstream beaches, this is the place to be. It has excellent eateries around and our kids love it this place. We stay here once a year to get away. Huntington and seal beach are close by if you would like to do some shopping.

We live close by this best western and when we have extra guests in town that do not fit into our home, we have them stay here.  It is with in walking distance of our home.  It is clean and comfortable.  Try to get a room on the harbor side as it is on a busy road.  It has nice views of the harbor and a block or two from the ocean.  My friends get up early and the breakfast and coffee would not be served for an hour later.  The nice staff put on the coffee and had it all ready at 5 am for them.  They make you feel welcome.  All our guest have really enjoyed their stay here.  There are several restaurants within a mile or two of here. Schooner at sunset is a good place for a beer and a burger.  Harry's Grill is more of a fast food place that does not serve alcohol, but has great

Summary Heading: Nice clean hotel close to beaches
Summary: Most reasonably priced hotel we found close to beaches in Huntington and Sunset Beach area.  Great overall experience.  Anni at front desk was extremely helpful as well as other staff.  5 Minute walk to beach,  lots of restaurants close by and Bolsa Chica ecological reserve area.   Cheap grocery shopping within 10 minutes at Trader Joe's.  Free parking at hotel.

Small very clean well ran hotel.  Clean Bathrooms, Coffee and tea in rooms. Comfortable beds.  Rented 3 rooms.  No complaints.  Close to beach access.  Tight spot for parking.   No fee to park...Breakfast was good.  Cereal, waffles, yogurt, hard boil eggs, toast. juices.  The only thing the grandkids didn't like was no pool.  Decor was ok.  Anything you need just ask the front desk.   Would stay here again.

Great location great staff and can't beat the price!! Nice n cosy!! Got to run across beach before work and hit the bars walking after. A friend told me about this place and he was right on!! Big rooms and clean!!  Oh also free wifi n breakfast!i visit HB about 4-6 times a year usually stay main HB but it's nice and quiet in sunset beach.

My boyfriend and I were pleasantly surprised when we opened the door to a beautiful room w/a balcony! We sat out there relaxing just watching the traffic roll by on PCH. The bed was a very comfortable, great big king! Definitely will stay there again!!

The desk employees were wonderful and my room was completely refurbished.  Everything in my room was clean and new-looking.  There were a couple of reasons I gave 4 instead of 5 stars.  One was that the chain lock was broken on the door, making me nervous that someone with a key would be able to get in while I was sleeping.  Second, my room was on the odd-numbered side, which was the street, and the traffic was pretty loud.  So, if that is a problem for you, ask for a room with an even number.  Last, the woman in the breakfast room did not speak/understand English.  I asked he if she had any less ripe bananas and she said, "No English".  Luckily, I speak Spanish, but I don't think someone working where guests may need things should be a limited-English speaker.  One more

Summary Heading: Great staff, good rooms, good restaurant and beach within walking distance
Summary: I stayed here on a business trip as it was close to where my meetings were located. I was extremely impressed by not only the property itself but also the very attentive staff. They were quick to help with all of my requests with a smile.  I would highly recommend this property and will definitely be staying here again on my next trip out west.

I'll start by saying that the staff were lovely, very friendly and attentive. Its close to the beach but a long way from pretty much everything else. I see on other reviews that it's close to restaurants? If you consider McDonalds and KFC style places as "restaurants" then you're set!! Breakfast is terrible. The plates are polystyrene and the silverware is  plastic, coffee is served in paper cups and the pastries are either doughy or like cardboard. The rooms are at least 30 years out of date and the whole place needs to be repainted and revamped. We had 2 nights booked but paid up and left after only one! My advice to you would be drive past this "hotel" and look for something closer to the town. I just can't see how the hotels ratings are high in a country that prides itself
Manager Response: Thank you for your review regarding your recent stay at our property.   Your business is very important to us and we value your feedback. By telling us what you liked about your stay and how we can improve, you are helping us deliver a superior experience for you and other guests in the future. We hope you will come back and see us again soon.  If I can be of assistance in the future, please don't hesitate to contact me at 562-592-4770.  Thank you again for taking the time to write this review. We appreciate your loyalty to our brand.  Sincerely,  Sunny Patel Manager BEST WESTERN Harbour Inn & Suites

Summary: I chose this hotel because you don't have to pay for parking but at the same time I was a little nervous. The hotel seemed old on the outside. But my husband and I found the hotel quiet, convenient and satisfying. They had a great breakfast that was always kept clean and filled with food. The room was right next to the front desk so I thought it would be loud but it wasn't. We had good night sleeps. It sets just a walk away from the beach. The front desk guys were always helpful to us in knowing which restaurant was worth the price and reminded us to go watch the beautiful sunset. It was nice to have the car parked under the hotel, you don't here people coming in late at night slamming doors. It rained while we were there and found no problem There was always a space for us to

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel with view of the harbor
Summary: Everything was excellent loved the hotel the decor and colors of the room. the whole place was small and nice the rooms were big out looking the harbor.  the only thing I could possibly complain about was that breakfast ended at 9:30am

A great location and wonderful staff. We will definitely stay here again as we have family in area and always stay in hotel. We went on walk to nature preserve and it is walking distance to beach. We also  enjoyed walking canals and looking at amazing homes with boats.

Hotel is not hard to find. They have a small parking lot and elevator. The parking garage leaks and floods when it rains. To get to the front desk you must go up the stairs thru the crooked hallway. I was on the 3rd floor facing the pch. Room is not bad in size. Typical outdated best western style. Balcony was nice. Decent TV and good channel line up. Heating/ac unit was small and very inefficient. Room was drafty at some times and then the heater would run constantly til the room was like 90. You couldn't win.  Instead of replacing the unit they put a cheap bucket under it that leaks and causes the balcony to flood. Also the fan will blow hot or cold air in your face all night while you sleep. Bathroom is small and shower is outdated. Shower has poor water pressure and toilet
Manager Response: Thank you for your review regarding your recent stay at our property.   Your business is very important to us and we value your feedback. By telling us what you liked about your stay and how we can improve, you are helping us deliver a superior experience for you and other guests in the future. We hope you will come back and see us again soon.  If I can be of assistance in the future, please don't hesitate to contact me at 562-592-4770.  Thank you again for taking the time to complete this review. We appreciate your loyalty to our brand.  Sincerely,  Sunny Patel Manager BEST WESTERN Harbour Inn & Suites

Summary: Young man who works the front desk during the weekend is a great employee. Quick check in and check out along with his great service helped make this hotel much better than the rest I have stayed at in the area.

This location is phenomenal located right outside the Waterfront you got a beautiful view of the marina tons of and beautiful a beautiful scenery a 7-Eleven located right down the street and the bell desk guy is freaking awesome I got a very beautiful room (family room) far far back by the exit can't say thank you more than I already have you guys are very clutch for that night and I'll be back

Stayed at Harbour Inn and Suites while visiting friends nearby. Staff were friendly and we were lucky to be able to check in early as our flight got in at 9am. Room was outdated but clean, spacious and comfortable. Good location and very easy to catch an Uber around if you don't have a car, normally only took 3-4 minutes to arrive. I'd say the only really downside was the shower which wasn't very hot.

Summary Heading: Lucky To Have Gotten A Great Room
Summary: After reading a few negative reviews, I realized that I was fortunate to get one of the more recently remodeled rooms in this hotel.  My room was very clean, the furnishings were in good shape, and the service at the front desk was friendly, even fulfilling our request for a 2 bed room.  We had a balcony and the vanity/sinks are in the room vs in the bathroom.  Convenient but can wake a few people up at night.  This hotel is on the smaller side with 4 floors.  As it is on a waterfront/boat area, the atmosphere is quaint and cozy and not the hustle bustle of the area.  Others have complained that the traffic noise is loud but as a local Southern Californian, I didn't find it noisy at all, just  a few trucks whizzing by occasionally due to it being on PCH.  This ain't the burbs so

This hotel feels like a small, family operated hotel. It is adorable. The location is very cool, on the harbor. It is on the PCH, so I would ask for a room with a view of the the Harbor. We had no street noise in our room. I can't remember the young man that was working the front desk, unfortunately. But he made our stay! He was so personable and treated us like we were in a 5-Start resort. We would come back again, just for the service. But the room was huge, and clean. I know we got one of the biggest rooms, so I don't think they are all that size, but are probably just as clean. Overall an adorable town, and a great hotel for a great price. I would definitely stay again. Way to go BW! This is actually the second happy review I have done for a BW in the past couple of weeks.

this hotel is off the beaten path but close enough to restaurants, convenience store when in for the night, beach across the street.  Huntington is a close drive away with many places to visit and see.  Walking the beach or pier followed by shopping and dining. We totally enjoyed our stay.

Summary Heading: Best Western Value at Sunset Beach
Summary: Great place to stay.  Clean spacious room included a coffee maker and refrigerator and a good internet connection. Continental breakfast is served in a spacious dining room with a view.  It's just steps away from Huntington Harbour and the beach.  Since the hotel is on PCH, one may hear traffic during the day, but it is quiet in the evenings.  A good value for the $ spent.

Summary Heading: a great place to stay, have nothing special to complain about
Summary: a great place to stay, have nothing special to complain about, maybe it was full at the breakfast table, if I did not eat very early or very late. and internet disconnected often, maybe the staff could speak English a little slower :-)

The hotel is across the street from beach-however you do have to cross Pacific Coast Hwy. to get to it.  The staff here is great the room was clean and the breakfast is the typical-ceral, waffles, pastry items, toast, coffee.  It was perfect for what we wanted as we were in town for a wedding.

My girlfriend and I had a great time here at Sunset Beach.  The staff was great, recommended a few local spots to eat and drink, the beach was maybe a few hundred yards away, went kayaking biking and more...  would come back again for sure!

This was a very pleasant stay. Very small motel but it had all the amenities for a brief visit to the area.  Unusual arrangement since the lobby was on the 2nd floor, just had to adjust. Not pricey for the area. Clean and quiet. Air conditioner was pretty noisy though, if you are used to the humidity you can just open window.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel and close to beach
Summary: We had a great stay here, only 1 night. We were greeted by a very frustrating fly man who gave us tips for dinner and a map with how to get to the beach.   The bed is firm but still very comfortable. The bathroom basin is in the room and shampoo, conditioner, body wash is in dispensers in the shower. The shower head is not adjustable and in our room (206) is slightly pointed at the wall.   Free wifi that's ok, not too good for watching Netflix. Good little parking area.   There's a complimentary continental breakfast which is pretty good, lots of cereals, oats, noodle cups, bagels, waffles, nice yoghurts and fruit. The power cut while we were in there, but literally everything was going at once - tv, waffle iron, toaster, microwave, fridge, water cooler, juice machine...so yeah

Great, low key place to stay in the Huntington Beach area. Located at the Sunset Beach end of HB it's away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist hotels. It has been there awhile and when we first arrived we were not to sure about our choice. Turned out fantastic! Friendly staff, clean facility, nice continental breakfast and free parking. Great value, I would highly recommend this place.

Now that I've been to Sunset Beach, I am in love.  Super great food, quiet beach, and amazing access to all that from the front door. Upon arrival we were greeted by super friendly staff who answered all our questions and took the time to help us get comfortable and even provided beach towels!  The breakfast was really good as well with fresh fruit, yogurt, granola, toast, cereal and waffles.  Good coffee too!  Highly recommend this spot.

Love the location...the accommodations.....comfy bed...breakfast....helpful manager and beach access....room decor is nice....spacious bedrooms...refrigerator and microwave are useful.  Booked online and trust Best Western standards.

Summary Heading: A great small hotel near the beach
Summary: This hotel is in Sunset Beach, right on the Pacific Coast Highway, and only two blocks from the beach.  The area boasts several restaurants and shops that trade in beach stuff, plus rentals for watersports.  The hotel is great, offering clean, spacious rooms and a breakfast.  A great place at a reasonable price for you to stop and enjoy the beach life.

Very clean hotel and super helpful staff. Just a short walk to the beach. It's an older hotel, but just as nice as the newer ones we stayed at. You can't beat the price. The free breakfast was an added plus.

Stayed here for one night as we were travelling through. The hotel is small with not many rooms but our room was fab. Great size with fridge microwave huge bed and pull out bed. Staff are very friendly and the beach is just over the road - though a busy road to cross you can walk up the road to the traffic lights and cross with the man ! Beach is beautiful and a few restaurants to dine at nearby! We tried SAS which is to the right as you come out of the hotel! It was lovely food! There is a 7/11 also across the road !!

Summary Heading: Good location, not bad for the money!
Summary: Booked this very close to travel time, researched location, liked the slighlty away from downtown huntington aspect. parking included and on first level...we had room with a very nice balcony overlooking the harbour, Charming because the harbour is all private homes form charming to quite grande and it was christmas time, so lights and decor was abundant. We had a situation in our room with some personal items being gone, day one of stay. Of Course we called and went down to Front desk and I was quite upset. letting front desk know, they claimed no knowledge, they magically showed up after 2 days. These were medications, which created a long distance pain in the %#@one day spent on phone with Dr. CVS trips etc. Not the best experience needless to say- cannot say it was 100%

Summary Heading: Great place in Sunset Beach to stay!
Summary: We had a nice large room which felt like a suite with a couch. Desk fridge and microwave. The extra large king bed was wonderful. The hotel staff were all most friendly and helpful. The hotel and room are very clean and comfortable.

This is a small hotel with no pool, but next to Huntington Harbor and a couple of blocks from the beach.  Parking is underground and if you have a large truck it can be a challenge trying to park.  There is a 7-11 across the street and many restaurants along Pacific Coast Hwy, but no fast food places nearby except for a Jack in the box.  One can easily bike over to Bolsa Chica State Beach for a long bike ride along the sand and ocean.  The bike trial will take you to Huntington Beach and all the way to Newport Beach.  There are also kayak and stand up paddle boards that can be rented right next to the hotel.  The staff here at this hotel are wonderful.

The hotel was small and it suited our needs - it was clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff was friendly. We would definitely stay again. We had a reunion in Huntington Beach and this hotel was close and the price was great.

My wife and I picked this as a stop between here and there.  This hotel was great for that, but we would've gladly stayed here for a week.  The hotel was clean and had very large rooms.  It was right across the street from the ocean.  It's not right in Huntington Beach proper, but just a bit north.  Would stay here again.

I don't know if we got a bad room or what, but I can't say our room was up to BW standards based on the other two BWs we stayed at that same week in San Diego and Las Vegas.  All these glowing reviews make me wonder where we stayed, as this place isn't that great.  The room had broken items (phone, light switch), missing any bath towels, even a sink plug that was unscrewed and from a different "finish" - antique bronze for the plunger in the sink with polished chrome for all the other parts on the sink.  I should not have to screw in your sink plunger for you, BW!  The room felt very used and a new bed cover does not change that.  I was truly disappointed with this hotel.

We got a suite which was very spacious, had an ocean view & harbour (2 balconies) it also had two large T.Vs, microwave, fridge And coffee machine. It had two separate rooms which I loved, although one room had a bed and the other a pull out sofa bed which not as comfortable as the bed. The views were great, front desk help was excellent also! The only bad part was the hallway had a musty smell, and the key wouldn't open our door so we had to change it. Other than that I thought the coffee was excellent as well as the breakfast! The staffs kindness & willingness to Always help was awesome. There are also several restaurants in walking distance, parking is Free! I would stay here again :) !

Small hotel, perfect location, right across the highway from Sunset Beach.  Staff was so friendly & helpful.  Simple, clean rooms. We had a coffee maker, fridge & microwave which made it nice. Quiet with the windows closed even though it was a busy road right outside.  The breakfast was continental, but well stocked & the area was clean.  There are no outdoor areas to enjoy at this property, but it was perfect for our stay.  Would come back in the future!

The location was good for us as we were meeting friends at Brix which is nearby. The hotel is a little worse for wear and showing its age. The breakfast room offering was probably on the bottom end of all the BW's we have stayed at, but what really ticked me off was when I asked for a late check our (and even offered to pay extra) First guy at the desk told me "yeah, should not be a problem, we are quiet on Monday night. Next guy that came on shift said "cant be done, we are fully booked". So I checked online, and plenty of rooms were available. Guys, if you are going to tell lies, at least lets all get on the same page. Anyway, it was an average/below experience.

Stayed here for 5 nights recently. Warm welcome from reception staff who were happy to supply lots of helpful information about local bars and restaurants. Rooms were a good size and the bed was super comfy. Clean and tidy but a little dated compared to what we are used to. Situated on Sunset Beach, we found this hotel was possibly a little further away from the hustle and bustle of Huntington and Newport beaches but served as a great base. Lots of great bars along the main road with good service and food on offer. Tips: visit the beach which is a very short walk away and watch the sunset - just beautiful. Be prepared to run like hell to get across a very busy very wide road to get to the beach.  Roadside rooms can be noisy but did not affect our stay.

Summary Heading: Hesitant to stay, but glad I did
Summary: To be honest, I haven't stayed at a BW in a long time.  I travel a lot for work and always stay at other chains.  A colleague I was traveling with likes BW for the value, and this one in Huntington Beach looked decent.  The good:  Huge rooms Comfy bed Friendly staff Comfy room with good wall air conditioner Nice balcony  The odd:  My remote control came with cover/sleeve that said "Fresh remote" My room #324 overlooked a private apartment about fifteen away.  Poor people have no privacy  The bad:  Very little, but don't plan on a good breakfast. Location is weird, but it is convenient once you are able to make it out onto the PCH (tons of traffic)  Overall:  Definitely recommend!  Don't expect a beachfront hotel, but you're not paying for one either.  It is clean, great rooms,

Summary Heading: Close to the beach but away from most of the traffic
Summary: I like that this hotel was located at Sunset beach.  We only had to cross one kind of busy street to get to the beach.  We drove to Newport beach and I-5 was really busy in that area.  I was so glad that we stayed at Sunset beach where the traffic wasn't so bad.  We were right next to Huntington beach.    Management was very helpful!  The guest computer wasn't working so the man behind the service desk let me email my ticket order to him and he printed them out for me.    The breakfast was okay.  They had boiled eggs, cereal, fruit and you could make your own waffles.   The room was clean and I loved the colors!  I liked the crown molding in the room.  The room was very spacious plus we had a balcony, which I loved!  I sat out on the balcony every night.  It was worth the money.

I have stayed at quite a few hotels, many more expensive, and these folks compete with the best of them.  Sunny is a good manager, evidenced by his choice of staff.  They have all been very courteous, accommodating, pleasant and professional.  Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel across from Sunset Beach
Summary: My husband and I went on a road trip from Phoenix, AZ up through California, Oregon, and Washington over the last two weeks. This was our first stop! My formula for finding a hotel in the city/town we were looking at stopping in was first price point, then good reviews. We stayed at many hotels, some great, some rather questionable. This one was great! First of all, it's directly across the street from Sunset Beach. HUGE bonus, especially considering the price. It's friendly, clean, easy to get to, free parking, and has spacious rooms. What more can you ask for?!
