The Secret Spot is within walking distance (advertised on your room key holder, but we had already researched it). Highly recommend it for breakfast or lunch, vegetarian and vegan options galore! We probably wouldn't

Summary Heading: Great location next to harbor and kayak rentals
Summary: Enjoyed our stay at the Harbour Inn. The staff was polite and helpful, the location was excellent (next to kayak rentals in the harbor, a few good restaurants, Sunset Beach, running path), and our stay was affordable. Parking is free and so is breakfast. We had a room overlooking Hwy 1, so it was rather noisy during all times of the day/ night, but that is what you get if you want to be close to the ocean, I suppose. The rooms are big, the bed comfy, the bathroom was somewhat outdated.

This hotel was perfect for my December 2015 visit to family and friends in the LB/Los Alamitos area.  Location could have not been better. The staff was helpful and friendly. This would be my first choice to book on any return visits to southern california.

Summary Heading: Nice little spot by the beach.
Summary: Went there for quick weekend getaway, we had a warm friendly greeting and check in was a breeze, it is just across the street from the beach, great access to a walking and biking trail. Had a hot tub in my room with an amazing view that I really enjoyed. There isn't much of a choice for breakfast and coffee wasn't that great and we had noisy neighbors but I would stay there again for the price the large rooms and location.

Hotel staff is vwey friendly. Have to give them 5/5.  Hotel room is nice and cozy. There is everything you need.  Breakfast is awesome if you compare to other american hotel breakfasts. There is also some fruits and proteins (milk, eggs). Good selection of coffee and cereals. Also some good juices.  Wifi is working.  Hotel has its own parking lot and thats is great thing.  Only minus is that hotel is next to highway and lot of noise coming to room from the street. But if you have your earplugs on at night you can manage. Disturb little if you are sensitive in sleeping.

The staff couldn't do enough for us. So helpful. The room was massive, and spotless. Cleaned every day. On the Pacific Highway at Sunset Beach, you can walk to the beach in 5 minutes. There are several restaurants within minutes walk away. This was excellent value for money as well. Enjoyed staying here.

Very nice place and they accommodated our group very well.  Close to great eateries and beach.  Had a good breakfast and the staff made the stay very nice.  Very nice place to stay and get away for sure.

We were greeted by Micheal.. Such a friendly guy. Offered great area information. Always asked about our day when we returned.. The Lobby, breakfast room, Our room were very nicely updated. The beds are very comfy. They offer larger hotel rooms than others I have been in. Very clean facility. Parking comes with room and is under the hotel. Larger vehicles may have to park on street.  Location is Great! One block from ocean-beach. The Continental breakfast was more than I expected. Waffles, bagels, cereal, toast, yogurt, Hard-boiled eggs. Juices, coffees. The breakfast hostess kept every thing clean and filled.  There is a small workout room in the building (which we did not use, so cannot comment on equipment) One thing we encountered was the outlets by our sink were loose and

Summary Heading: Love to stay at Best Western Harbour Inn & Suites, Sunset Beach, California
Summary: This is our choice hotel when we visit the Huntington Beach/Sunset Beach area. We have stayed at this hotel several times, a couple of times prior to the new ownership and about 3 since the acquisition. Though it was a nice experience the first 2 times, the hotel needed some updating. Since the change in ownership there have been several updates and improvements on amenities. The location is great with the only drawback being traffic noise from the PCH. But one must expect tradeoffs. The Breakfast is good, but could be better; and we were told that one of the goal is to modernize the serving area including upgrading the breakfast offerings to include more hot breakfast options such as eggs, sausage, bacon, biscuits and gravy along with the already available, and popular, waffle

This is a very nice place to stay for the right price.  The bed was a little too firm for me, but other than that I have no complaints. I loved that it was so close to the beach.  The breakfast was a typical continental breakfast.  The rooms were clean and the staff was very nice.

The room was very clean and the king bed comfortable.  If you are a light sleeper, ask for a room not on the highway.   It did not bother my husband but I started to hear the traffic fairly early.  Otherwise very good place to stay. Breakfast was plentiful with waffles, hard boiled eggs, smoothies, etc. Across the road is the beach and the hotel had free parking. Cleanliness, parking and continental breakfast was what we wanted and this Best Western had that. We would stay there again.

This hotel is very small but,  nice.  It's right on the PCH but our room was quiet.  The room was large and clean.  Beds are comfortable.  Continental breakfast is good and the dining room is really cute.  The staff is great.  Close to walk to many restaurants.

Rates on Sunday were much higher than they were on Friday and Saturday, which normally at other hotels a Sunday through Thursday rate is lower. When we inquired about it, the desk clerk basically said there was nothing they could do about it!

My husband and I were pleasantly surprised by how beautiful the scenery was of the marina. The hotel room was spotless and everyone was kind. The location is great and the community was very quite. We will definitely stay here again.

First the good things: The room was nice, clean and the spa tub was a plus. Now for the other stuff: For some reason the TV had two remotes, one for the cable box and one for the flat screen. The cable box had to be reset to the proper "mode" each time you turned it on (Got a "No Signal" box) and then when you turned on the TV, you actually had to stand to the side of the screen for the channels to change. They really need a cable guy to sync the remotes so a guest doesn't have to be so techy! Now for the front desk: We booked online and prepaid for our room, so check in was easy. However, when we checked out the next day, the Desk Clerk was very confused and couldn't produce a receipt, so he said he would "mail" it. Two hours later when we got home, there was an email receipt

Even with free WiFi, this is not a business hotel.  However, for an individual or family get-away, it's well priced, in a location with easy access to beach, restaurants and other attractions, clean and has a very friendly staff.  Complimentary breakfast is bountiful, even though I would have appreciated a dairy free "milk" and peanut butter (but not sure peanut butter can be provided in CA.)

We were in town to visit family.  The hotel was clean, beds were comfortable and we were within walking distance of the beach.  A very nice place to stay.  Parking was very tight which was the only concern for me.

Very clean, nice room, especially for the price!  Near beach; will stay hear again next time I visit family in this area.  I was also allowed an early check-in which was very nice.  Trip advisor is telling me to add text.  Blah Blah Blah

Excellent Value & Service, location was a 10. My family was visiting from out of town and was delighted to stay there. I would definately recommend this hotel for friends and family! Walking to various beaches, restaurants and bars was a breeze. A car would not be necessary to dine out and have a good time.

This hotel was like a Boutique style hotel, with the staff being respectful and accommodating. I would recommend this Hotel to all my friends and colleges. I cant say enough about the friendly staff . and how quiet the maid staff was. The location was perfect for the closeness to the beach as well as shopping and good restaurants.

I was here for one night in December 2015. The staff was very friendly and tried to be accommodating. I asked for a room facing the harbour instead of the street and they gave me one where, from the window, I could see both the harbour and the street. The only thing that was a bit irritating is that I know the two rooms that were next to me and that fully faced the harbour were empty. I wish that they had put me in one of those instead BUT it could be because I booked the room online and got a good deal. Those rooms may have been suites or something nicer.  The room itself was clean and nicely decorated. The television had many cable channels and of course movies that you could pay for but no premium channels such as HBO. Having breakfast in the morning was really nice. Waffles

The rooms are a bit dated but clean. The rooms open directly to the outside.  I prefer hallways...but that's just me. We booked ahead 2 nights but only needed to stay one night. The desk was nice enough to refund the 2nd night when they were under no obligation to do so.  Thank you.

THE GOOD:  We have stayed at this Best Western before. It is clean and quiet. The person at the registration desk is very nice. He has a very good attitude. THE BAD:  The pillows are terrible. They are totally lumpy and it does affect your sleep.  The decor is drab and rather dark. It could use some updating.

what a find!  I will definitely stay here again on any return trips to southern California.  I was looking for an easy to access place (and did not want to pay extra for parking) in the loos Alamitos/seal beach area.  this hotel was perfect.  super friendly staff and charming small hotel.

It was sooo nice when we arrived. First of all the lobby is on the second floor which I loved. Then when walking to our rooms, all the door where open to the rooms like a bed and breakfast. Our room swere gorgeous and so comfortable i wish I had spent my whole trip to LA here.

Used for a one night stop over as down in Orange for business. Unlike the Renaissance LAX it has shower gel, shampoo and conditioner. Considering the cost of other hotels ( gym , bar, etc) this is perfect for a short stop over. harbour view lovely, rooms tired but very clean. If you don't want to stay in your room all day then this will work.

Love this hotel, free parking under hotel, perfect to go to the beach and shopping is about 2 miles. Lots of thing to do around and near to hotel. Just next to hotel you can rent surfboards and little boats. Rooms where clean

the breakfast offered had very little variety. Could be improved upon greatly. We ate at local resturants instead.  the hotel is located very close to the beach and is a short walk to see the ocean. Beds were confortable and the room was clean.

This was a very good choice in the area.  The room was comfortable and quiet.  There was underground parking and a decent breakfast.  There is a lot to do in the area and it's a very convenient location for getting around Orange County.  My daughter and I were very comfortable there.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, but very loud outside
Summary: Rooms were very comfortable, but right on the Pacific Coast Highway.  Literally!  Very loud during the day and does quiet down in the middle of the night nice.  Having a microwave and small refrigerator in the room is a plus. Good free breakfast too!

This place is gorgeous.  Right across the street from the beach.  Nice breakfast included in price.  Clean hotel with fitness center.  My room was large with a balcony and super comfortable bed.  Parking was included.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I was in the area.

This hotel is in a prime location to the beach and some nice entertainment. It is 30 minutes to orange outlets and walking distance to sunset beach. it was an excellent choice. Clean and friendly. I'd definitely stay here again.

This is a very small hotel in a Sunset Beach.  There is free parking, and we have no problem getting a spot, but I suppose it could be an issue since it was limited.  There are signal lights to cross PCH, but if you just want to go directly across (where the 7-11 is) you'll probably find it inconvenient to have to get to one of the lights.  Sunset Beach is between Huntington Beach and Seal Beach which both offer many shops and restaurants.  However, there isn't much in Sunset Beach, so if you want to walk anywhere from the hotel there isn't much (there are a few).  Right next door you can rent a kayak or stand up paddle board and cruise around Huntington Harbor.  Keep in mind if you want to spend time at the beach there appeared to be no public facilities on Sunset Beach (though

Very nice, updated, older hotel with good location. Free parking on first floor. Breakfast included. Rooms on second and third floor. Right on PCH, but back room (202) was quiet. 7-Eleven across the street. Sunset Beach is also across the street. 3.5 miles to Seal Beach.

Summary Heading: Best Western Harbour  inn and suites
Summary: This hotel is across the street from the beach.  Major highway but there are crossing lights. There is paddle boarding rental next door.   Beds are comfortable and rooms clean but the place could use some refreshment.  Breakfast comes w the room. Basic pastries, some fruit, cereal.   There is a small workout room. Equipment is old.   However,  there is a lovely walkway along the beach.   Had a room with patio and view of canal.  Overall nice place to stay.  About 6 miles from downtown Huntington beach

We wanted to stay somewhere a little less crowded and Sunset Beach was the perfect fit.  The hotel lobby was clean and the front desk staff was helpful enough.  The guest rooms, we had two, were bright and clean, but the one was quite noisy on PCH.  Our bathroom was a mixture of about three different styles and the shower head control ring fell off while we were using the shower.  The rooms seemed a little dated.  Breakfast is included with your room.  However, if you want to eat anything other than carbs you will have to go elsewhere.

For the price and photos, we didn't expect much of this hotel. But it was very close to our daughter's home, so we gave it a try. We were pleasantly surprised. It was clean, quiet, and had a large room with a comfortable bed. Breakfast was adequate. Internet was slow, but that's pretty common at hotels. Location close to beach was convenient, although crossing the street on foot was difficult.  All in all, we would stay here again.

Summary Heading: GREAT LITTLE BW ON THE PCH!
Summary: Stayed just one night in this small Best Western on the PCH. Nice staff, clean and large rooms, decent breakfast, and the beach is right across the street. Free parking and no complaints! Close to many restaurants too. If you're looking for a nice King room, ask for #326. Top floor with harbor and PCH view.

This property is close to the beach, and is also located right on the PCH, which is heavily trafficked and noisy most of the day and night.  The balcony we had in our room was more or less pointless, due to the noise level and lack of view.  The rooms are dated, with odd additions such as sinks in the sleeping area.  The bathroom was quite dated with patterned tile.  It was clean, though the carpet in our room had bulges/ was no longer fitted, and the carpet cleanliness was somewhat dubious.  The breakfast was standard and just ok.  Overall, a property desperately in need of updating, but not bad for the price in this location. Free parking.

We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel.  The front desk staff were very helpful and informative.  Great place to relax. The location is close to the ocean and harbor but not too close.  Very quiet and quaint. If you kayak, the perfect place to stay.

Summary Heading: You dont get what you pay for
Summary: Most of my reviews are very positive. This experience was not what i was expecting.  We checked in on a Friday for my friends wedding.  The Hotel is located on PCH which is very noisy and it is across the street from the beach access.  There is a slight view of the harbor which is nice.  The hotel we booked was one that had a Jacuzzi, but the room we were given alas did not have a Jacuzzi, we mentioned it to the front desk but since the hotel was booked solid they could not accommodate us.  The room we were given was HUGE, probably close to 500 sq feet.  It had dated furnishing and appliances.  The shower head leaked with poor water pressure, and the two wall unit ACs could not keep the large space cool.  In conclusion, the employee at the front desk was rude to my girlfriend.

Nice hotel but a little on the expensive side. Beware as travellers on the pacific coast highway, the hotel says Huntington Beach but actually it is Sunset Beach. We were told, oh it's all one long stretch. The beach was awesome with only a block across the busy highway. The room was clean, spacious and the front clerk was very nice and helpful. Bonus, parking was free

We booked for one night ,last minute and arrived at the hotel to realize it was sold out. After having flown cross country and had nowhere to stay, this was disappointing. I was able to work with Best Western and they set us up in a room at the Sunset Beach location. It exceeded my expectations. I am thankful for the staff and their quick response.  The location had comfy rooms, clean and a good view.

We were at the Beach for the annual Huntington Beach Sand Soccer Tournament -  The hotel was 10 minutes Huntington Beach --The hotel is near Everything --the staff was great the room was great --would probably ask for the non-PCH side next time - The room was very clean and the Breakfast was a perfect light breakfast

Liked the staff.  Thought everything was clean.  Quiet rooms. Very good size rooms, had two large queen beds, and a pull out sofa.  Average continental breakfast, as expected.  Quite close to Sunset beach, within walking distance.  Very convenient to have 7-11 across the street. Captain Jack's is down the street.

Stayed for 2 nights and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel and staff.   They went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Came in late and they offered us bottled water to bring to our room. They don't keep peanut butter out in the breakfast area, due to food allergies, but brought it out for me both mornings. Explained the sights and places to go with excellent directions and suggestions. Hotel is small, but well kept up and clean Staff was always polite and friendly. Close to the beach and there is a great kayak and paddle board rental right next door. Lots to do in this area!!

We booked 2 rooms for three days. On arrival, 9:30pm we were given a balcony room overlooking the Pacific Coast Highway. Using the balcony or even leaving the window open was not an option The following morning I requested a room on the canal side. Although almost full they found a larger room and met me half way on the addition rate. As our other 2 rooms were coming in by 2:00pm, I requested they locate them on the canal side and have the rooms ready, they did One evening we asked if we could use the breakfast room for a small reception (8people)  for a couple of hours, granted. Despite the property is not visually great. housekeeping and maintenance are very good. ALL STAFF WERE OUTSTANDING AND ACCOMMODATING - THEY GET A 10

We were told about this place by a family member we were meeting in Long Beach; otherwise we did not find it on Expedia. It was across the street from the ocean next to Seal Beach. Decent place, decent price. Comfortable bed. Breakfast til 9:30am.  Great location!!!  Not a luxury place but definitely adequate for our needs for 2 nights.

I was looking for a location between Long Beach and Newport Beach and this was perfect. Free parking was a plus. Room was large and comfortable. Not as crazy as Huntington Beach, where I stayed last time.

Summary Heading: The place that you want to relax.
Summary: the location was easy access and parking was good. The lobby access was good. The staff Greg the night manager who was excellent and provided great knowledge and locations of places to see. The rooms were clean and well stocked with all necessary needs. The harbor view was great to see. The breakfast was great and there was an attendant that supplied all our needs. The stay was one that yes we will return. Thanks Best Western Harbour Inn and Suites. It was a great weekend stay.

This was a clean small hotel. Nice continental breakfast. It is close to some good restaurants and a nice beach. There really isn't a night life unless you go into town. The biggest problem was the noise. You are right on pacific coast highway. Day or night it sounded like the traffic was going right through your room. It was very tough to sleep.

Summary Heading: Clean Room, Older Property, Great Value
Summary: I will stay here on occasion when I can't get a room at the high-end Hilton in downtown HB.  I travel here frequently for business.  There are virtually no amenities, but there is free parking.  They are across the PCH from the beach (and a few stores and homes), but I haven't visited the beach at this hotel.  They do have rooms overlooking the harbor.  Generally, a great value for this area, but nothing fancy.  Good people, though.

Clean, well maintained, comfortable, Not fancy, No crystal chandlers, no valet service. Excellent staff services all pleasant good people willing to help. Great location 1.5 blocks from Pacific 3 min walk.

Summary Heading: Advise you to stay here if in Huntington Beach area in Spring
Summary: Quick, easy, and satisfying hotel stay for an unplanned stopped along a trip for conference and fun in Southern California.  Great friendly staff who care about your stay and well being.   Maybe Greg will be around to direct you.

Summary Heading: Great Harbor View Rooms - TERRIFIC STAFF!
Summary: A warm, friendly greeting at check-in with terrific advice for restaurants within walking distance.  The harbor view room we stayed in was lovely with an intimate balcony overlooking the water.  Very clean room with all amenities in perfect working condition.  The internet had good signal strength with no "dropping out" etc.  We would definitely stay here again!  Thank you!!!

The Hotel was ok.. It was clean and the breakfast was just the usual.. I was however very disappointed in the Harbor view. It is a parking lot for boats around a few houses. It is NOT a big Harbor at all.  Our view as a little water and the street. Our room was fine..  the bathroom light is on the bedrooms side, behind the door.. strange

Summary Heading: Hey, you're at the beach right?
Summary: Overall everything was fine at the hotel.  The room smelled a little musty, but I didn't bother saying anything about it.  I was only there for one night.  Friendly staff a block from the beach and good breakfast.  Really, not much more you could want.  The hotel itself was clean, but I rated the cleanliness average because of the musty smell.

hotel was nice only thing we didnt like was that you have to cross busy street to go to the beach and crosswalk was far away.  the hotel looked like it was newly remodeled and very clean . Staff was nice

I still believe Long Beach is a terrific alternative to the sprawling metropolis of L.A. From Long Beach, you are about 30-45 minutes of the Southern California Family Experience. i.e.Medevil Times(jousting nights while you eat your dinner-Farrell's ice cream restaurant is down the block) ,Disneyland,Hollywood ,Santa Monica Pier,Newport Beach(Fashion Island Mall). The staff was great, but  the" hot meal" consisted of waffles only, the room was moldy,soap dispensers were empty, the light was out , and we had disrupted phone service between room to room. No pool or sauna. However, the price was reasonable,no parking fees,Huntington Beach was a 5 minute walk away.Rooms in front picked up road noise for it is on a major street.

Overall, very helpful staff and clean rooms. However, we have had an issue with checking in and out a few times as well as some broken appliances. Having a balcony is lovely and the furniture on the balcony is always clean.

Summary Heading: Lovely quaint hotel at a great location
Summary: The staff was helpful, the rooms were nice and tidy, and the location was superb (just a skip and a hop away from the beach - mind you there is no nearby crosswalk so be careful). Plus you get a decent free breakfast. What more can you really ask for?

balcony room facing the101, right on the highway, only the very loud vehicles caused a lot of noise with the balcony door closed, no view, not a very pleasant balcony overlooking the street, no harbor views from this direction, limited view of residential canals rather than a harbor from other rooms, covered parking on first floor, walk or elevator to second floor checkin, king bed, couch, spacious, typical continental breakfast, no eggs bacon or sausage as another review indicated, close to nice beach and famous water tank house, microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator. hair dryer I have no more to say, I can't believe I have to write more words to exit this review, I have no more to say, I can't believe I have to write more I have no more to say, I can't believe I have to

Summary Heading: Good short stay at the beach
Summary: My family had business in the area and we decided to stay near the beach. Our stay was brief though, checking in on a Monday early afternoon and checking out late the following morning, and we didn’t spend much time at the hotel. For our purposes, the hotel was just fine. It was near where we needed to be and right next to the beach, which was just a short walk across and past PCH. Being the off-season, it was pretty dead at the hotel and the beach. I can’t imagine how crazy it is here on a summer weekend. The parking lot at the hotel is small, so parking might be an issue during the busy season. There’s a 7-11 across the street and numerous restaurants in the area.  Our room was spacious, but the sinks and vanity were part of the room, with the toilet and tub in a separate

This hotel is located right of the main street and across from the ocean within a short walking distance. The other side of the hotel faces the harbor and it has beautiful views from the balcony in your room there

You could smell how clean the room was as soon as you opened the door and the staff was really nice. Very pleasant! A+ (Now I am just adding characters to the review because what I had posted was not enough. LoL)

Great price, the staff was very nice, will stay here again for sure the next time!!! Even though we were in a room on the Pacific Highway it was quiet, even for a Friday night.  The gym had adequate equipment, the breakfast was good.

This was a beautiful location on Pacific Coast Highway. Plenty of parking in the bottom level. Staff was very accomodating. The room was very clean and had a balcony overlooking PCH. Continental breakfast was well presented with many options.

This is a great hotel that has close proximity to the Sunset Beach.  We enjoyed our time here, the staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. Lots of restaurants within 4 blocks. Breakfast was adequate and well prepared.  Parking below the building out of the sun and we had a balcony that we could sit out and enjoy the nice weather.

Summary Heading: Best Western Harbour Inn Sunset Beach
Summary: This Best Western was a comfortable place to stay and a good deal for the price in Huntington Beach. We stayed in one of the suites with a balcony overlooking  the canals--a nice place to sit and read if you're staying for a couple of days. The décor was a old fashioned but the room was clean and comfortable and everything worked well. The breakfast was typical self serve and adequate. We particularly enjoyed the beach a short walk away and renting a kayak to paddle around the canals.

Summary Heading: Great spot to feel like a local....
Summary: Staying near some iconic LA beaches, right on a busy highway, couldn't bring you any closer to action unless you created it!  Clean, tidy and great, helpful service, with good local guidance helped us enjoy our pass thru LA.  Would happily return.

Me and my boyfriend have stayed here before and decided to come on a random night the front desk guy talked us into paying for the room with a balcony and the big jacuzzi tub. We loved our room and were having a great time, beds are comfy, it's quiet, bathrooms are nice, the big jacuzzi tub was clean and relaxing. My boyfriend enjoyed having the balcony looking at the harbor, across from a liquor store, underground parking, close by to lots of places. But as the night went on my boyfriend noticed a giant cockroach on the wall he killed it and than saw a baby one by the sink so I don't know if there were coming from there but it completely ruined our night it was to late to say something or get a refund but we felt very dirty and just wanted to leave after that it sucks because

Summary Heading: Harbour Inn - A Great Gathering Place
Summary: We were in town for a wedding in which our group occupied several rooms in the hotel.  The hotel is in a very central location for Huntington Beach, Long Beach, and surrounding areas.  The rooms were a bit dated, but clean.  Our room had no view, but was on the quiet side, away from the road.  Those that were on the road side (most with balconies) mentioned that they could hear traffic noise during the night.  Those that had the harbor view said it was a decent view, but could still hear the road noise.  The hotel front desk staff was superb as they were both extremely friendly and helpful, always offering assistance.  Whether it requesting a restaurant recommendation, toiletries for the room, or providing water after a run, we could not have asked for more.  Greg even provided

Positives, the room was clean for the most part though the carpets were about due, but the bedding was nice and white so that's fine. It was fairly quiet though it was during the week, the last nightwhich was a Saturday night, when the hotel became more crowded my husband couldn't sleep.  Negatives The hot tub wasn't even warm.  If you want a hot tub don't stay here. The first night the one guy fixed it or turned it up.  But after that it was about 70 degrees, not a hot tub water, and it wouldn't have bugged me as much as it did but we actually picked this hotel because it had a pool and hot tub.  We could have stayed closer to the ocean and saved $20, and if i would have known I wouldn't have stayed here.   The pool was freezing and i can live with that, but you say you have a

Didn't see this coming; expected mediocre but instead discovered a gem. Will definitely stay here again. The proximity to Huntington Beach and Long Beach provided plenty of things to do and great places to eat.

Summary Heading: Good value, helpful service, great location
Summary: 3-minute walk from the beach.  1-minute walk from the harbor.  My mother was exhausted and wanted Chinese food delivered.  The hotel clerk found a place nearby and called them for us.  The only negative thing was the bathroom had a 12-inch step up to get in, and I was afraid my visually-handicapped mother might forget about the step and fall and get hurt.

Summary Heading: Nice clean hotel close to the beach
Summary: We stayed several days over Christmas and we were pleased. They have an elevator which is nice especially since the parking is on the first floor. As others have commented, parking can get tight. I believe this will be a bigger problem during the busy summer months but I had no problem with my minivan. Something I'm not used to but apparently not an issue is the parking, elevator and entrance doors are not key-carded. They are open to the public. They do have plenty of security cameras and lots of mirrors but... something I'm not used to. The balcony was nice to sit out on and enjoy the air.

Summary Heading: Clean and Comfortable with No Frills
Summary: We needed a hotel for two nights,over Christmas, on a tight budget. This hotel delivered. Sunset Beach is a funky little town, minutes from bigger beach cities Seal and Huntington. The hotel was clean and comfortable, and the room and bathroom were bigger than usual for a Best Western, which we really appreciated. For a family of four, it was just fine. The staff was friendly and approachable. Our son wet the comforter and sheets on the bed and the linens were promptly changed without incident. Ample free parking under the hotel. The only complaints: the breakfast was just carbs and dairy, which we avoid; and the "amenities" were lacking in the room. There just weren't a lot of breakfast options (waffle bar, bagels, sugary cereals, fruit). We went out to eat in downtown Seal

Summary Heading: A SMALL NICE HOTEL ON THE HARBOR.
Summary: You will have a pleasant stay.  Our room was clean, quiet and convenient. Judge it for what it is:: A small independent hotel which affords a pleasant experience. Don't try to compare it to high-end hotels because that's not fair to a hotel of this type.HOTEL It is clean, pleasant and you will not have any complaints.

The Best Western Harbour Inn was everything the other reviews said it was.  It was very clean and in excellent condition, even though it was an older building. The Sunset Beach location was very convenient as a starting point for sightseeing in either direction. If we had wanted to, we could have walked a few blocks to the beach and to several nearby restaurants.  We appreciated the free parking and the selections offered for the continental breakfast.  All of the front desk staff were extremely helpful, even offering us food after breakfast hours. The friendliness of the staff made us feel good about staying here. We reserved a harbor view room, and I was a little disappointed that our room seemed to be the only one without a balcony, and no room with a balcony was available.

We stayed for three nights in November.  The hotel is small, not many rooms, but the rooms are large.  Ours had a fridge and a coffee maker.  Every area of the hotel is clean and the staff were very helpful and pleasant.  The beach is only a block or so away, across the PCH,

Our stay was very nice.  The room we had was spacious, clean and quiet.  We had a view of the ocean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast area serves an assortment of cereals, coffee, sweet rolls/muffins, etc.  There is also a parking garage with elevator access to the floors leading to the rooms.  Easy access to the local beaches.  We'd definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Best MID SIZE HOTEL IN SUSNET
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for a getaway. and loved it.. was a great find  for the price.. Clean , great service and lots to do. rooms with a view.  book here and glad you did.. great bang for your buck!!

I did have a number of issues when I was here, but overall this was a place I would come back to.  First the good things.  Alex at the front desk was extremely friendly when I checked-in, and gave a number of suggestions for places to eat dinner.  She was on duty only half the evenings (not over-night) the days I was there.  When she was there, I a presented an issue, she was able to get it resolved quickly.  Room was clean, and spacious.  Although facing the street, there wasn't a lot of noise.  There was a balcony I was able to enjoy the west view after sunset.  Liked the in-room safe with the computer code (as opposed to a key), so I felt more secure leaving my belongings.  The bed was very comfy, and the AC worked nice.  Good water pressure from the shower.  Enjoyed the

An October getaway for our anniversary was just right at the Harbour Inn. The staff is very responsive, knowledgeable and efficient. It is so close to the beach, great restaurants and wildlife refuges along the coast. The "off" season is more affordable and relaxing - we will be back soon!

Small, right off PCH.  Friendly staff, clean room, right across the PCH from the beach.  Free parking and breakfast is a big plus as there doesn't seem to be much parking in town.  Walking distance to some cool places to eat and ocean fun rentals close. The hotel was quiet although, there is some street noise. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay even better.  We will be back :)

I have to admit I was a little nervous looking at this hotel from the outside, but the inside is great- rooms are updated and modern.  This hotel is within walking distance of restaurants and bars and literally right across the street from the ocean! You simply cannot beat this value!

Best western hotel is a older hotel, kept very well, clean and décor was good. The Front desk is excellent, friendly, helpful and professional. I enjoy staying at the older hotels especially at a beach setting, the beach was across the street with easy access. I would recommend this hotel for a relaxing get way

We were attending a reunion in Huntington Beach close by.  This hotel was recommended to us by a friend.  It was a pleasant surprise!  The front desk staff was friendly and helpful.  The room was large and inviting.  It was like staying at a boutique hotel right on Pacific Coast Highway without the huge expense.  There was a jacuzzi tub with a wonderful shower, a large comfortable bed, a sitting area with a sofa, separate sink area with a large well lit mirror, refrigerator and microwave.  The television reception was excellent.  There was adequate parking underneath the hotel.  In such a heavily populated area that was a major plus.   I would stay here again, and will recommend this hotel to friends.

Nice hotel with comfortable bed. The breakfast and coffee were better than most hotels have in the morning. It's close to the beach, dining and shops. Street side is a little noisy, but not bad. Will stay there again.

For a beach hotel this is a very quiet property. Rooms are quiet and staff is very accommodaing.  Beach is right a cross the street.  Plenty of places to eat, including Captain Jack's where my wife and I have dined for the last 6 years on our annual visit here. We had our grandaughter with us the last couple of years and it is too noisy for her.   If you go there expect a noisy atmosphere but generally very good seafood.  First five years were excellent, however this year it seemed the quality suffered a little.  Great little street marked down the street on weekends open until 2.

Summary Heading: charming small hotel near the beach
Summary: Found the place relatively easily - parking is under the hotel but not underground - was well shaded and was checked regularly by staff -- to check in you have to go up the one floor ( there is an elevator) and there are two floors of rooms - check in went very well - very friendly young lady booked us in - and explained all around -- room was a king balcony facing the highway -- difficult to leave the balcony door open for fresh air as highway pretty loud -- with the door closed though it was great - air conditioner was a little loud and pretty much needed to be on all the time -- though you would get used to it -- the bathroom had a toilet and shower/tub and the sink was outside in the room  The shower pressure was fine though a night light would have been appreciated in the

This hotel was purchased by Best Western a few years ago (less than 10 years). The old hotel had large rooms and Best Western kept them large. The rooms have balconies too. some rooms have two sinks in the bedroom, some have one. We used 3 rooms. Our first 3 nights we were in a king with a huge jacuzzi tub in the room. I was with my 2 teenage children and so we went in it one at a time with our bathing suits on. The jets were great and it was a great way to relax after our busy days exploring the coast. The parking lot was well lit with security cameras. They have an elevator from the parking lot or you can use the stairs. There was always a friendly staff person on duty for anything we needed. The a/c worked in each room. The tv and frig and microwave were modern. The breakfast

Wonderful hotel, great location.  Was traveling with 2 preteen girls, a 1 year old, and my husband.  Was able to get a fold-a-bed very cheap.  We all fit comfortably in the room.  We were able to walk to the beach across the 1 freeway.  We came to spend some time at the beach and then head to Disney Land on another day and it worked out very well!  Breakfast was a little weak- we had gotten use to the eggs, sausage, and potatoes that other best westerns provide.  But over all it was very nice.

The decor and staff were charming and our room was great - particularly for the price and the proximity to the beach and harbor. Free breakfast was a plus and we had two decks in our suite. Would highly recommend a stay.

You can't beat the price for this location. Very small beach city with open beaches. Free parking. Uncrowded beaches. Walk to eating establishments if you want to. Rentals nearby. Wind surfers use this beach. Fun to watch them. We got the two room suite. It had two balconies. One on the ocean side and one overlooking the Harbour. Two large TV's. My granddaughter loved it. No pool is the only drawback.

Summary Heading: A little gem by the beach
Summary: Awesome! The whole room was clean. My family and I will definitely come back to stay here. Staff/owner was very nice to talk to.  And since I grew up in Las Vegas ,a city that  has the lock on hospitality.  I  know a good hotel when I stay at one.

My husband and I stayed in a suite room  with a view of the Harbor and private balcony where we sat and enjoyed our glass of wine and appetizers. (the room is equipped with a nice size refrigerator and microwave oven).  Being on the Harbor side and at the end it was just the quiet room we wanted.  The tropical decor was lovely, but they should upgrade the sheet quality, comfortable bed, but I've had better linens.  The location is prime, walking distance to the beautiful beach, restaurants, local liquor store....the perfect location for our little jaunt to Seal Beach as well, for my Dad's 85th Birthday Celebration.

Summary Heading: Pearl in the sea find. Great place!!
Summary: My wife and I came to this area and found this place. Loved the jacuzzi room with a Harbour view. Awesome. Highly recommend it. A walk to restaurants bars and kayak right next door.  Also great covered parking for my Porsche.  Staff was also great very helpful.

They have a couple of rooms that provide a great view. Front view which has a look on PCH, and the back view which has a nice view of million-dollar homes/water front - All at your leisure to choose. Relax, and take a candle lit bubble bath if you'll like.

Worse BW stay ever.  Reservation that was made by phone was wrong so we had to pay another $100 for the only available room left.  Our room was not turned down at all during our stay, had to call reception for towels.  New girl at check out messed our bill up and had no one to call for help so we checked out not knowing our final amount billed.

Great location.  It is a quick walk across Pacific Coast Highway to the beach.  Room was clean without the typical hotel smell.  Because of typical CA beach density window ventilation was lacking, but good quality AC made it easy to keep room comfortable

Had a room with a harbor view, away from the highway. Very comfortable and quiet. The bed was a very comfortable king size. Small balcony with a view of the water. Breakfast room small with the typical choices, but the waffle maker was fun.

Summary Heading: Unique, authentic So. Cal. beach location.
Summary: Stay in rear away from busy PCH, but stroll across the street at remarkable residences on the beach. Tsunami sushi down the road is an appropriate dining/drinking choice. Sadly, very few spots like this remain...

Small "homey" hotel, rooms were spacious, clean. Convenient to beach, restaurants. The staff was friendly, very helpful when needing suggestions on places to eat.  I stayed there by myself and felt very safe.   I would stay there again!

A very comfortable room, a great night's sleep, and friendly staff make this hotel a great choice when passing through Orange County.The desk clerk was extremely friendly and helpful, giving us good tips on nearby restaurants. Extremely comfortable beds.

This location was absolutely ideal for the price of the room.  The beach, activities, and restaurants are within walking distance (just be careful crossing the PCH) with a knowledgeable staff to give you recommendations on where to go.

We needed a place to stay near Sunset Beach, California to be in close approximation to a family get together.  Upon checking in, the cleanliness of the room and the cleaning process was evident...all shiny and smelling fresh....spotless linens, etc.. This is, as is most of Seal Beach, right on Pacific Coast Highway, so I would recommend a room facing East...but ours facing West was fine with the air conditioner covering the noise of the highway.   Great and friendly staff, and a breakfast also!!!

Summary Heading: A welcome respite on a difficult journey :)
Summary: My stay at this small hotel across from the beach from was a such a blessing. I had to book a place at the last minute as my friend had passed away and I needed to spend a few nights to attend a funeral nearby. The staff was stellar! From the moment I called to book the reservation to checking in and the great coffee and breakfast in the homey area by the office I felt at ease. AND!! Most comfortable bed ever!! I will get the name of the manufacturer as I am in the market for a new bed...it was the best night sleep I have had in ages. No backache in the morning...  The rooms were clean and had everything I needed was right there to also work while driving back and forth to Long Beach. Ironing board, hair dryer, lotion, shampoo were readily available as well as. coffee pot and

A nice place to stay with easy access to the beach. The front road is a little busy but noise doesn't travel through to the rooms very much. We had a scenic suite with lots of room for our toddler. Parking is tight but adequate. The decor is older but clean. I'd rather if they lowered the rate and did away with the breakfast. All in all, we'd stay there again.

My must-haves: Cleanliness, quiet room, plenty of natural lighting, spotlessly clean and comfortable bedding with high thread count linen, a view, free wireless, in-room coffee maker, and real half-and-half for my coffee. Nice-to-haves: Robes and slippers; free and convenient parking; newspaper. My travel: A mix of business and pleasure this trip.  What a delight- and a surprise - to find that Best Western fit the bill for this trip and exceeded my expectations. My travel dates were unexpectedly changed, so I "Price-lined" my room at the last minute and got a rate of $85 in an area known for $185 hotel rooms. I just needed a clean comfortable room for one night, and wanted to be close enough to the beach that I could run across the street and take a dip in the ocean. The hotel

Pros: Good parking, great staff, nice rooms, comfy beds, decent price for the area. I'd stay here again. Staff was helpful with rental places, diners, etc... The large flat screen was a plus also.  Cons: Slow drains and internet kept kicking off, this was frustrating.

This is a great little boutique hotel with cozy and comfortable rooms. The staff are outstanding and ready to help with anything.  Free parking, internet, and breakfast all contribute to the experience.

Best Western Harbour Inn & Suites, Sunset Beach, California is a  clean, comfortable hotel. The rooms are nicely appointed (nice, soft towels), breakfast is adequate and staff is friendly. The location worked for my purposes and I appreciated covered parking.

This was the first time I stayed at a Best Western.  I was very impressed with the cleanliness and comfort of the room.  Staff was friendly and the price was  very reasonable.  This hotel was across the street from the beach.  A great deal.

I am a former flight attendant and my husband a pilot so we are very familiar with staying in hotels. We both found the accommodations more than satisfactory. In fact we thought it was great. OK the towels were a little thin but, hey, it wasn't the Ritz. But the staff was better than the Ritz. Very accommodating and friendly. The room was very good. Housekeeping very good. Overall a great stay. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Summary Heading: Overall Cleanest and highest Quality hotel in Sunset Beach.
Summary: This hotel is located in my favorite town in Orange County, CA. - Sunset Beach. Located on PCH, the beach is directly across the street. A sidewalk with nice/clean public restrooms and 24 hour FREE parking runs along the entire length of the 1.3 mile town. All the vintage local restaurants and bars are within a five minute walk, just head north on PCH from the hotel. The front desk people are helpful and know the best places to eat and drink. As a Best Western, I know that this is the cleanest and nicest of all the 10 or so hotels in Sunset Beach and is generally lower in price than staying in Huntington Beach for example. I prefer to stay in this quaint, friendly little town and if I feel like going to Main St. in HB or up to 2nd St. in Long Beach, they are both only a 5 minute

Small, friendly, hotel with variety of rooms to suit all tastes.  Located in sleepy township close to beach.  No bright lights or noisy neighbours and no parking meters.  But then there are no shops.  Ideally located for most LA tourist attractions and shopping malls.  As usual for Best Western hotels, the beds are extremely comfortable.

So we stayed here for 3 nights in the spring. Rooms were nice. Parking was convenient right under hotel.  Breakfast was ok. Waffles and Danish with fruit. It worked. Would stay here again for sure. Location is right on the PCH. Getting to the beach was just going to a cross walk and then you have the beach to yourself.

The staff was excellent and interested in making our stay an enjoyable one.  They were always willing to make a fresh pot of coffee, or bring us extra blankets or towels.  The room could use some work, some of the furniture was water damaged, sleeper couch should be reupholstered or replaced.

The only thing that could have made our stay better is if the hotel was located on the beac side of Pacific Coast Hwy. Our room was a little noisy at times because the balcony overlooked the Highway but really was not a problem. We arrived before noon and they were kind enough to let us check in early. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We would definately stay here again.

I reserved a room with a view and they gave us a room looking at a building. They claimed to be fully booked, yet the vending machine was empty.... my sister-in-law reserved a room as well and their light in the restroom was out and did not get fixed the entire time. They had to use the restroom and shower with the door open for lighting....

I had stayed at this Best Western before and liked it better then. The staff is still great, but the breakfast is lacking. There used to be a waffle maker but from what I was told the hotel was purchased by a new owner and the permit for it has not yet been received so… no waffles. They ran out of the premade breakfast sandwiches so all that was left was bananas, apples, cereal and yogurt. Those things are ok, but less than satisfactory in my opinion. I’d still stay here; I just hope the breakfast gets better before I do again.

The happy beach mural in the lobby lets you know that the atmosphere here is relaxed, the staff are friendly, and there is everything you need, including a sandy beach just across the road and many local cafes with great character. This spot is a hidden gem.

For a nice quiet little beach town, there is very little in the way of middle of the road accommodations.  Finding myself spending New Years eve in town with a couple of other couples, I opted for this one while the other couples went to a more inexpensive option down the street.  We were quite happy with the large room with a nice balcony while our friends had nothing nice to report on their rooms.  The help was friendly and helpful.  Parking was a bit limited, but available in the lower level garage, although I had to park in a non marked spot at the instruction of the night manager due to a full garage.  Is it the Hilton?  Of course not, but quite clean, comfortable and well within what you would expect for the budget.

Stayed here with my husband and we both loved it. Rooms were nice and clean, staff was extremely efficient and helpful. Very small relaxing hotel right across the street from the beach. Will definitely stay here. Loved the ambiance. I'll be recommending this place from now on!

The room with jacuzzi is a good place to relax and enjoy the quality time with a partner. The only negative part is the parking and the sink. Parking is limited and the room sink on our room is clogged.

A friend and I stayed here for two nights - the first night in a room with a balcony on the Pacific Coast Highway side.  The highway is definitely noisy so we switched to a room on the backside of the hotel without a balcony.  This room was exceptionally large (due to no balcony!).  In fact, both rooms were a good size.  The beds were great - very comfortable, four pillows each!  It was clean.  Free parking is underneath the hotel at street level.  Breakfast, however, was a bit of a disappointment - but I assume that is because we were there during the week in an off-season.  Very few options and not all that appetizing.  All in all - a very good value.

My husband and I have stayed here twice - the first time was in 2012 and we loved it -- comfortable rooms, nice breakfast, very close to the beach.  OK, it's still close to the beach (just across 1 street) but they are obviously undertaking some cost cutting measures. The breakfast is inedible now (they removed their waffle maker!!!), the milk is warm, and the bugs are a'buzzin.  It's no longer worth staying here - with so many cheap options along the PCH, next year we will stay somewhere else.

Great hotel....looks nothing from front but rooms are big and very very clean!!! Stayed with my family and was awesome!!! Must try burger place across the road, only small but awesome salads!!!  Drove into Huntington from here and was a easy drive...would def stay here again!!! Breakfast is awesome too!!! Thank u

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel in a fun town
Summary: Had a harbor room. Not much view but the room was huge, great under the building parking, comfortable beds, room service from the local pizza place. Easy walk to beach or a lot of restaurants.  Easy place to stay and reasonable for a beach town.

Summary Heading: LOVED IT! Delightful area and hotel to match!
Summary: After carefully reviewing my options in the area many times over, hoped and prayed this would be as nice as I'd hoped. It WAS - asked for and received a quiet room - walked over to the beach easily two different days- DELIGHTFUL time! Nostalgically ate at Don the Beachcomber's nearby (formerly Sam's Seafood) - took in the local charm, and drove around to Long Beach, Los Alamitos, Buena Park, etc. in the evenings very easily from here. They were fairly priced, and great to get breakfast here before I hit the beach! My room was extremely comfortable, and slept extremely well in the wonderful bedding. Nice view of lagoon, yet no noise whatsoever. Felt very private yet so close to the beach! Great service from the front desk, and helped me with accommodations and retrieving

Read the reviews before making reservation, but party was staying here.  Breakfast is OK, coffee is hot.  Vanity in room so if you are the first one up, don't turn the light on to see unless you want to wake up the other.  Parking is terrible.

We loved this place! We had a conference at the Ritz in Marina del Rey, but I prefer a small town beach atmosphere. Older hotel but very clean, staff very friendly & helpful. I loved the laminate floors (no musty damp carpet after going to the beach)  I would get up each am, grab a free breakfast, walk 2 blks to beach  and enjoy!   Clean beach, wide walk, jog, bike path, it has a pier with shops and eats, large grass park with playground.  I felt very safe, town people friendly. Yes you crossed a street to beach, but not a highway.  I did not notice traffic sounds in room with AC on. We rented a car to drive to conf but would have rented a car for sight seeing and the parking was free, covered,  well lit, & few steps from room. No valet needed.   We stayed 4 very comfortable

My wife and I stayed here rather than in Long Beach for a dog show.  As others have said, there was some road noise from the highway, but we didn't notice it too much since we had the air conditioner on.  The room was very clean.  The whole property looked liked it had been recently updated.  It is very close to the beach.  I would call it across the street and one block.  It is very convenient to a lot of other beaches and restaurants too.  The parking was a little tight, but the limited access also made it feel a little safer than at some hotels.  The breakfast could have had a little more variety, but it was okay.  All in all, it was a good place to stay.

Located on PCH directly across the the street from the beach.  Really, all you have to do is walk across the street.  The downside is that the street noise is a bit loud if you are staying on that side of the hotel.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  Continental breakfast was nice.  Room was in good condition, and had some great amenities (microwave, refrigerator, balcony seating, nice toiletries).

We we cery disappointed with this hotel. When we booked through the Best Western Reservations Line we were made to believe this hotel was "on the beach". The discription says 200 ft from the beach.  We were no where near the beach, well a good 2 blocks from the beach.  You could not even see the beach. Not very easy for a wheelchair to get around.  There is a private harbour behind the hotel that has a small sandy beach area, but it is a private area for the residents. Not available for hotel customers. There is no pool or jacuzzi.  The breakfast area is up 2 steps and not available for the wheelchair bound.  The room however was great, it was set up very nice for wheelchairs.

Summary Heading: Nice Old Hotel in a Nice Old Resort Town
Summary: This old place calls itself a boutique hotel. Boutique now also means rustic and quaint, I guess. I liked the place. Parking is on the ground floor of the building. Watch out for the posts. One way in and out. Our room had a comfortable king-sized bed. The room had automatic light switches that didn't work automatically, at least to our satisfaction, but did work when we manipulated them. No decaf in the breakfast room or else it was unlabeled. Maybe that's why I'm still sleepy. Also, no decent dry cereal unless you're nuts for Apple Jacks and Frosted Flakes. How about a dry cereal with less sugar such as Cheerios or Raisin Bran? No eggs or waffles. This is not a "plus" Best Western but it ain't cheap either because of its "resort" location on the speedy PCH. I detected little

I chose to stay here for 4 nights instead of near the Anaheim Convention Center for a conference there. Best decision ever. My Jr. Suite room was huge, with 2 sofas, desk, fridge, microwave & a view of the harbor fom a private patio. The beach was a walk across the street. I watched the sunset every night. The hotel was very quiet. Meanwhile, in Anaheim, my colleagues reported their rooms were small and they heard kids, excited over a trip to Disneyland, running up & down halls all night & slamming doors. My smart phone GPS routed my drive efficiently, and I was never in traffic, even at rush hour on Friday night. The hotel staff were polite, the location was great, my room was clean and the price was right for me. A great value and so worth it to get away from the convention

Summary Heading: Travelers Tip at end of review... MUST READ...BEWARE!!
Summary: There are some things this hotel can not improve on, it is just the way it is...right off of Pacific Coast Highway, all the rooms facing that way (which ours was) is WAY TOO NOISY, we had to blast the TV just to try to drown out the noise, we called the front desk to see if we could be moved and were told nothing else was available, which may have been true, it was a Friday night and not very many rooms at this BW, which is probably good because the underground parking is very hard to get in and out.  We had a balcony but could not use it and besides our view was a 7-11 and a Liquor store with a wrought iron basket of dead flowers attached to the balcony.  The breakfast is more like a "continental" with juice, coffee and danish, not much compared to other Best Westerns with a

I never went to this hotel . .  canceled the reservation an they still got a authorization hold for over  $600.  This experience has truly affected my relationship with Best Western.  I called but to no avail.

Made a reservation online.  Didn't expect much.  What a nice friendly and clean motel.  Breakfast was what you'd expect.  Would definitely stay here again.  Brought our bike 2 minutes from the path to HB.  They let our leave our vehicle in the garage the day we checked out while we rode.

Location of this hotel is perfect!  Had to call the desk for a missing bath tub stopper, but it was handled quickly.  The lights and phones were unplugged when we arrived, weird?  And don't stay in room 201 because it is right next to the lobby.  The desk person was on the phone talking loudly at 2 am.  But breakfast in the morning was nice to have available.  And again cannot beat the price for the location.

Exactly what we wanted after looking for hotels in the area. Very large room with private balcony overlooking harbor. Small hotel 25 rooms, great service. Parking under hotel is tight. Will stay again when in area.

I had read previous reviews about lack of customer service and an uncaring attitude especially with noisy room assignments. It's all true as I am sitting here listening to loud traffic and still waiting to hear back from the manager after over 6 hours.   Everyone here has said they are sorry that my room request was not honored but other guests are being assigned to those rooms based on their requests! What I have yet to understand is why their request is more important than mine?   Plusses: clean room, room size, tall shower head, proximity to the beach.  Minuses: VERY NOISY, mattress hard, view of dead plants and bird droppings from balcony, bathroom sink as a nightstand (it's next to the bed), no regard for customer requests and most importantly staff just didn't care!

Unexpectedly awesome view of the laguna of Huntington Harbor right under our smallish but cute balcony. Some slight traffic noise from Pacific Coast Hwy. but our room was in the back, so nothing major. Good size room, with a mirrored jacuzzi (no comments, use your imagination to fill in the gap), good, solid king size bed, tiny but well appointed shower. The proximity to canoe and paddle board rentals a big plus, as parking would have been scarce if we wouldn't have had our guest spot under the hotel. Nice, accommodating staff: I came to the reception late one night asking for a source of cream and sugar for our coffee, and I was allowed to get them from the breakfast room. By the way, the so called continental breakfast is included, but honestly, there is not much to chose

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay in Sunset Beach
Summary: Beautiful views from our room.  Large, clean well appointed room.   Comfortable bed.  Accomodating staff.  Made my birthday weekend (and my son's wedding weekend) very special!  A special thanks to Juan!    Mr and Mrs Kenneth Olson

First, at the time that you book a room, be sure to ask for a room off of PCH.  The noise levels are truly too loud and cannot be masked.  If you wait to request a room at the back until you arrive, you won't get one.  Second, book early if you need two beds; the sleeper sofa is far too uncomfortable to get any sleep.  The mattress was all springs.  Third, if you like a good breakfast, plan for an added expense to eat elsewhere.  The quality of the breakfast is very, very low.  Fourth, if you are coming in the summer and plan to use the air conditioner, be sure to bring along ear plugs.  You will not believe how loud it is as it blasts on and coughs off.  That said, it is hard finding many affordable places in Sunset Beach.  So, just come prepared.

Summary Heading: Hidden Jewel Close to Beautiful SoCal Beaches
Summary: After living in California for many years, 5 of which in Santa Barbara, I thought our recent Christmas vacation to SoCal would be nice but nothing surprising. How pleasantly surprised was I. The outside of this hotel looked OK but inside the room was large and well-equiped. We had nice sleep and woke up early. Breakfast in the spacious upper floor lounge was so relaxing ... sipping hot coffee while looking out to the back canal in the morning light made me feel like in heaven. Huntington Beach is just a short drive away where we hanged out all morning then came back to wash the sand off our feet before we went on to see other attractions. We paid our annual pilgrimage to Downtown Disney at night, just to shop and soak in the holiday festive air. On the departure day while

The staff are very attentive and nice, and sincere. The location is great, you can walk to many restaurants and bars, a surf shop is across the street to rent gear, parking is sufficient, and the room was a good size, with a microwave and mini fridge which was great. It's an older place and not the Ritz, but we really enjoyed our stay and felt very safe.

Summary Heading: While nothing fancy, probably the best place to stay for the area
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for 1 night in April 2012 and we were very pleased. This Best Western was very similar to the Best Western my wife and I rave about in Laguna Beach (see my other review), however, the amenities are not as extravagant and this hotel in Sunset Beach is much smaller with limited rooms.   The hotel is close to the beach with the adjacent side from PCH facing Huntington Harbor. Our room, which was the last room available, was facing PCH and surprisingly, you could not hear the traffic all that much. I like to sleep with the AC on anyway, so that drowned out any traffic noise.  The breakfast in the morning was more than the average continental breakfast. The staff was nice. The room was clean. The bed was comfortable. I really can't complain much other than

My husband and I traveled to California to visit our daughter in Long Beach for a week and found this great inn on the AAA website. It was an easy 20 minute drive from LB airport and close to her. We were warmly greeted upon arrival and ushered to a king-size suite on the 3rd floor with a fantastic view of the harbor from the balcony. All amentities were as advertised (fridge, microwave, bath goodies) and the huge bed was so comfortable! We loved that there was parking on site. Also, a continental breakfast each morning with more than the usual treats. The Inn is right across the street from the beach where we spent quite a bit of time. We would definitely stay here in the future!

Summary Heading: Spacious room, but not the greatest view
Summary: I surprised the husband with a little mini vacation in Sunset Beach. A band we like was playing at Don the Beachcomber's and I thought it would be fun to go down, have dinner, see the band & stay overnite. Even though the 777 motel is right next to Don's, it seems kind of sketchy, so I looked at TA for something close that was nicer.  I was only booking about a week out & the only rooms left were the "Harbor View" suites that were $125/$145 AAA rate (the higher-priced room offering an in-room Jacuzzi tub). Since I didn't think we were really going to be spending too much time in the room, I chose the lower-priced of the two. (As an aside, after looking into some other dates, it looks like you can usually get the non-Harbor View standard room for about $10 less, by the way). I

Summary Heading: Good hotel, we enjoyed our stay
Summary: My husband and I enjoyed staying at this hotel. Friendly staff that answers questions about local areas. I'm always a fan of any hotel that has a waffle maker to "up" the quality of their free continental breakfast instead of just having pastries. Nice, clean area for breakfast, and very clean rooms with nice decor. And LOVE the free parking. We get tired of scouting places that want an extra $15-20 per night for that. It's unfortunate the balcony rooms include a view of such places as a 7-11 instead of the beach, but that's true of all hotels in that area as it's mostly homes and rental properties that get the ocean view. But it's a quick walk to the beach.  You will hear other people's toilets flush. But that was about the only noise we heard on a sold out night. We ordered

i stayed at this hotel last weekend, because of my job, i stay in hotels 75% of the time. i have not felt prompted to ever write about a hotel,but for the price,this hotel was fantastic.  i have never been in a cleaner hotel!  Also parking was easy, free, breakfast was perfect, and the beach was a block away, But again, rarely have i stayed in such a clean new beautiful place, no doubt i will be back soon!
The room was average and was clean enough.  However breakfast was at least 45 minutes later than they had advised which meant we missed it as we had to be out early.

Summary Heading: Good stop for visiting the area from Huntington Beach to Seal Beach
Summary: We stopped here for 2 nights on our way up the coast from San Diego to Santa Barbara and were not disappointed with our choice. It is in a good location - cross the Pacific Coast Highway and you are on the beach. Plenty of good restaurants in the area within a short driving distance and we particularly enjoyed the Irish pubs at Seal Beach. A large clean room with Wi-Fi throughout the hotel. The continental breakfast was adequate and the hotel overall was good value for the price we paid.

Summary Heading: Few harbor views, but clean, spacious rooms
Summary: My husband and I have stayed at the Harbour Inn at least twice a year since 2005, most recently for a five-day stay in April 2011.  The property is MUCH improved since becoming a Best Western.  We stay here because we are visiting nearby family, and we generally opt for the least expensive rooms.  We've stayed in many of the rooms, and found them all to be quite spacious.  Only a few of the end rooms have a water view, though, and they look out on a tiny part of Huntington Harbor, not the ocean.  Most of the rooms face either Pacific Coast Highway or a a two-story house situated about 20 feet away.  We don't mind the smack-dab-in-your-face view of the side of the house, but we are pretty much there only to sleep.  PCH may present a daunting barrier for some who would want to

We loved our room.  Very spacious, super comfy pillow top mattress, quiet off the highway side for a great night's sleep.  Immaculately clean.  Right across the street from the beach, where we watched the sunset.  How's that, sunset at Sunset Beach!  The only thing that was below average was the breakfast buffet.  Not bad, but very little variety, and a few things missing, plus very weak coffee.  Overall, a great stay.

It was only a one night stop, but we were extremely happy with our room. Juan at the reception was very friendly and helpful. It's about a 10 minute walk  to the beach. The room, with a street view,  was large and very clean and comfortable. We also had a cute little balcony. The only hitch is if you want to cross the street to walk to the beach or go to the stores you have to go to the traffic lights. The Hotel is in the middle of two intersections of a very busy highway. It's quite impossible to cross in front of the hotel. But not  a problem if you don't mind walking a little or use your car.They have an open parking, underneath the Hotel with the elevator going to that level. The complimentary breakfast was very good. Later at night the traffic was not disturbing at all.

The staff was all star. No fake smiles, completely honest and knowledable. At times I was treated like a visiting dignitary. Best part of room was the harbor view. and covered private view patio.  Also had a large jacuzzi. Bathroom was small but adequate with good adjustable  shower . Located on the harbor and a block from the beach. Sunset Beach community is much more homey and less luxurious than other LA Orange County beaches.  562-592-4770. Speak with Greg, Sonny, Juan or  Bert. harbourinn@aol.com. harbourinn.net

Summary Heading: It's not the Hilton, but surpassed it by services and amenities for price
Summary: We stayed at the inn for 3 nights in mid September and were extremely pleased with our stay. It was a vacation before a competition for myself, and being from Atlantic Canada we needed to feel at home and comfortable, the staff did not fail. Our room was clean, with a beautiful view of the harbor,  we did not feel cramped as our room was spacious and we had everything we needed within a short distance.  The staff were helpful and friendly and did their best to help us when needed.our business then put us up at the Hilton in HB, and though newer and nicer, Internet, business center and breakfast were not complimentary and quite pricey so bigger is not always better!

Our experience was fantastic all the way. Sunset Beach is an overlooked town that is laid back and cool. What a lifestyle the locals have there. A great friendly place and this hotel fits right in. The hotel is very cool  and I love how they decorated it. The staff were happy and VERY helpful.

My husband and I stayed here for one night before heading to Palm Desert for a week.  The location of this hotel cannot be beat if you are looking for an affordable place close to the beach.  It is across the PCH from the beach, in an area that seems to be mostly residential.    I was kind of suprised that there weren't more reviews about this hotel.  It definitely seems to be popular, as it was sold out the night we stayed there - maybe people want this to stay one of those little hidden gems.    In any event, the rooms here are decent.  They are not very up to date or the most modern, but it did the job in giving us a place that was close to the beach for a single night.  They also have a complimentary continental breakfast, which was your standard cereal, fruit, and pastries.

My husband and I  stayed at this property for one night in April. We were in the area to attend a wedding and the majority of the rooms at the inn were occupied by others related to the same wedding. We were very much satisfied with our stay and have not heard of any complaints from anyone else who stayed.  I was impressed by the newer decor and cleanliness of the rooms. Our room had a microwave, mini-fridge and a sliding door that led to a small balcony. We enjoyed the cool, fresh sea breeze on what was a warm day.  The staff was very friendly and accomodating. They were particularly patient with the elevated noise level once the wedding guests returned after the reception. Staff politely reminded us that there were a few other guests staying at the inn and understandably asked

One thing you can say about this hotel is that it is CLEAN. You can tell that it has been newly remodeled and it has a "fresh" feeling to it.  carpet looks clean and new, which is a big plus for us.    The bed has a pillow top to it and was very comfy.  towels are a little better than your average motel (cotton & pollyester).  This place is just border line MOTEL to HOTEL.  Alot better than a motel, but far from luxiurious.    Room comes with a couch, which i thought was great when we brought sushi and movie.  Basic cable, with Discovery channel!   Spacious.  price was $140.  balcony is extra.
